story: Eating Apples brings strong teeth
story_txt: Eating Apples brings strong teeth

story:
Short Summary

My name is Moty Brill, i am an Israeli scientist holding a Ph.d in Nuclear Engineering. During 2007 I started to look into wave energy and developed a device that uses the energy to produce electricity. At that time Israel suffered from water shortage and I modified the design to desalinate seawater.

During 2011 I've met a member of government of Solomon Islands and decided to modify the design for 3rd world, isolated villages. People that die each day from lack of drinking water and diarrhea.

It moved me because nobody cares about them.

 This will not be a "money maker" project; it will not be a huge project with hundreds of workers. It will be a small, innovative, robust device which those people will be able to maintain, and it will produce precious drinking water.

I am looking for funds to build the first ever solution for those human beings. I am confident that after the first device will prove it is feasible, the World Bank and other NGO's will contribute their money to save those innocent lives.

Help me save lives.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for $650,000 which is my best estimation of the cost of detailed design, building the device in Israel and transfering it to the location in the Solomon Islands. The desalination container will cost ~$50,000 and the Hydraulics cost ~$40,000. The main construction which is a large and heavy marine device will cost ~$150,000. Detailed design ~$50,000 and shipment, deployment, preparation of the site and salaries for the staff will get us to ~$550,000. The rest of the money is for the unexpected expenses. 

Perks could have been the usual stuff: T shirts, medals, images etc. but, since we want to change the world, it seems to me that as I am working for the benefit of those poor people, you will understand and join me.

You are buying real drinking WATER. Cost of production is $6/1,000 gallons. This volume is enough for a family of 4 for a month.

if you donate $18 (drinking water for one person for a year) we will send you a letter of gratitude.

$60 will cover a family for a year and we will send a poster of the device and the happy villagers

$2,000 will buy water for the whole village for a year. your name will be commemorated on a special monument located in the village you saved.

$10,000 is our Platinum medalist. You will be invited as our guest of honor when the device will be delivered to the local villagers, to witness the difference you made first hand.

 

In case we will not raise the whole sum, we will try to raise the rest from other sources and NGO's and in the worst case scenario we will advance the detail planning until we run out of money.

The Impact

This project is a world changer. According to the UN, water scarcity will be the next global crisis. At that point the poor and weak people will die because of lack of drinking water. It is as simple as that. About one out of seven people will die because of water shortage. WE CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE. Together we can show the world that we found a solution just for those people, small, compact, cheap and easy to build and  duplicate. We can change the future and you can be part of this dream.

200 families in Solomon Islands will have clean drinking water every day for the rest of their lives. 1,000 people count on us for this solution. They don't have electricity, they don't have water pipes and they don't have money to buy water. Let us show that we can help.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have connections to NGO's that contribute to the 3rd world and/or friends that have marine knowhow, it can be a huge help to our project. Please tell your friends and colleagues about us and one day you might be proud that you changed the future of those people.

Thanks

Moty

story:
Short Summary

My name is Pete Holman and I have dedicated my life to helping enhance the health, fitness and performance of others. Today I am doing some of my most significant work in helping a wonderful non-profit called the Rocky Mountain Stroke Center. http://www.strokecolorado.org I will be holding an event called "Stroke for Stroke" which is simply attempting your personal best at the 500 meter row on a concept 2 rowing ergometer. Entry fee is a donation in the amount of $20 which will help fund social support, physical therapy services, community outreach and general health care for stroke survivors and their families. As you know, in these days of financial cut-backs, non-profits have been hit extremely hard; your contributions will make difference in many peoples lives!

What We Need & What You Get

Each participant gets entered into a raffle to win a TRX Suspension Trainer, TRX Rip Trainer, and an Ultimate Sand Bag (special thanks to Josh Henkin owner and creator of USB for this generous contribution.) Anyone able to beat my time will receive a Chaos Threads t-shirt and the best time will receive the "sword of Green Destiny" and eternal bragging rights as the best 500 meter rower in 2013: to be announced on my Facebook site Pete Holman (at TRX) Monday November 18th. Although we are asking for a $20 contribution per participant, feel free to donate more. Help us raise $1000.00 by November 17th and know that 100% of the funds go towards the Rocky Mountain Stroke Center.

Your Personal Best

Although some of you might compete with each other or try to beat my time, the most important thing is to push yourself physically and mentally towards your personal best at the 500 meter row. Don't worry, you have 6 weeks to train prior to "throwing down" your best time prior to the deadline Nov. 17th! You must take a picture of your time and post it on my Facebook site (Pete Holman at TRX) prior to Nov. 17th 2013 to be qualified for the free Chaos Threads t-shirts and samurai sword for best overall time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to compete or simply don't have the funds but believe in the cause; please share my video on Facebook and let people know about this event. Having a goal to attempt your personal best is a great way to hold yourself accountable, train to get in the best shape of your life and help a tremendous cause. Challenge yourself, challenge your clients, challenge your friends and lets ALL go "Stroke for Stroke" this November!

story:
The medical expenses for Jason's hospital  stay and subsequent therapy for recovery will  be in the tens of  thousands.

On September 26th, while Jason was out on his morning run, fell and hit his head, causing a traumatic brain injury. Currently, Jason is back home after time in the hospital and rehab and has undergone cranial surgery.

The funds donated will not only assist the family with current hospital and therapy bills, but it could assist the family with unforeseen bills.

Jason is making good progress but he still has a lengthy road ahead of Physical and Speech Therapy. Currently he suffers short term memory loss and suffers from bad to severe headaches. If you've ever lived under "abnormal" circumstances you know what a relief it is to return to "normal", not only for Jason but for his loving wife and his 2 great kids.

Jason came home recently. He is trying to adjust to  somewhat normal life and get back into a normal routine. He is has not been cleared to return to work. We are not sure when that will happen. He still has a long way to go and donations here will help ease his and Janets mind.

In these times of school fundraisers and Girl Scout Cookies, put your money on a winner. Help get the Edwards family back on their feet as soon as possible!

 What price would you out on a return to normal after your world was turned upside down? It's not just Jason. His wife marvels at his fighting spirit. His children just want to know daddy is ok. And his students are missing the teacher that pushes them past what they thought they could be.

Jason is an English Teacher at E.E. Smith High School in Fayetteville, NC. 

Jason graduated from SUNY Oswego, Oswego, NY, class of 1994. 

Jason graduated from Bishop Kearney High School, class of 1990.

 You can donate any amount. It does not have to be the $25.00 perk.

Janet will send a personal Thank You no matter what amount is donated.

"If you grow up in the suburbs of anywhere, a dream like this seems kind of
vaguely ludicrous and completely unattainable. [But] this moment is directly
connected to those imaginings. And for anybody who's on the downside of
advantage, and relying purely on courage, it's possible."

story:
"Volunteers are the only human beings on the face of the earth who reflect this nation's compassion, unselfish caring, patience, and just plain love for one another." (Emma Bombeck)

GLOBAL BRIGADE

(GB) is a secular, nonprofit organization that empowers university students and professionals to provide communities in developing countries with sustainable solutions that improve quality of life while respecting local culture and improving the environment.  


OUR STORY

Today, countries across the world face new global challenges necessitating new responses. As our leaders chart a new course in international concerns, we are seeking to promote a citizen dialogue about an issue of global importance: HEALTH

As avid believers in humanitarian healthcare missions in developing countries, the The Medical Brigade Chapter of York College in conjunction with the Premed and Biotechnology clubs would be grateful for you to become one of  the DONORS/SPONSOR for our first mission to Honduras so we can make a tangible impact on communities while gaining real life experience in the field of international medicine.


WHERE WE SERVE: 

                         HONDURAS

•Second poorest country in Western Hemisphere
• Population living below US$1 a day (%): 15
• Population living below US$2 a day (%): 80
• Poor access to health care
•Doctor to patient ratio: 1:1,667
•Half of rural population without access to health care
•Population: 7.6 million
•Infant Mortality Rate: 24.61 deaths/1,000 live births
•Total Fertility Rate: 3.38 children born/woman


THE BRIGADE:

A 7/8 day trip to Honduras with a group from your university to work on medical solutions includes: 

•Introduction to medical projects and Honduras

•Discussion with community leaders and meetings with the entire community
•Cooperation with Honduran patients and medical professionals.


.Total Cost
$650+airfare per students which includes:

·         Lodging

·         Guides and Translators

·         Sustainability

·         Meals

·         Transport

·         Miscellaneous


    Sponsorship would also, including two Medical Doctors and purchase of different medications, which we will take town with us. Your donations would determine how many people and supplies we can deliver to the people of Honduras.We are counting on your support and thank you in advance for your willingness to support the efforts of York College Medical Brigade and make a difference in the world so we "common people" can attain uncommon results. 



*Global Brigades is 100% student funded and led.  We are not reliant on any outside donations or grants to perpetuate our programming.  As such, we focus on empowering students with the tools and resources to solicit support for their individual brigades.  The "sustainability expense" enables us to maintain offices in Honduras, hire full-time native directors, provide housing for our long-term volunteers and manage the relationships and health trends in the communities we serve year-round.

story:
How can I order Levitation™?

You can order your bionic knee brace right here on Indiegogo.

How do I know if a bionic knee brace could help me?

We’re excited that you’re interested. Levitation™ can reduce knee pain while enhancing strength and mobility. This could be the right product for you if you have osteoarthritis, a knee injury, or do a lot of heavy lifting/repetitive movements.

Where is Levitation™ manufactured?

Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada.

How do I get the right knee brace size?

A knee bracing specialist will contact you to collect your measurements before your brace is made and shipped.

How long should my knee brace last?

Your bionic knee brace is made with exceptionally high-quality materials including our ultra-strong, light-weight carbon fibre shell and aircraft grade suspension system constructed from 17-4 PH H900 steel and 7075-T6 aluminum alloys. With proper care, your knee brace should last at least a decade.

I’m a medical professional. How does Levitation work?

Levitation stores kinetic energy generated during knee flexion and restores that energy upon extension. The result is a revolutionary product that not only stabilizes the joint, but also enhances strength and endurance while providing shock absorption to the most commonly injured joint in the body. Key features are adjustable force-output, customizable force-response (made to order), quick release strapping and functional joint stabilization.

Can Levitation be claimed on Insurance?

Our customers with medical insurance have been able to successfully claim their braces against their medical insurance plan. Coverage varies by plan, but is often in the 80%-100% range, and you may require a prescription from your doctor. Check with your insurance provider if you are unsure of your coverage amount or requirements. Also, be sure to let us know if you plan to claim the brace under insurance so that we can send you the appropriate receipt(s).

What does your warranty cover?

Our braces include a lifetime limited warranty on the brace shell and a one year limited warranty on the hinge mechanism. This is NOT to say we don’t expect our hinges to last – we have built and tested them to last for at least 8-10+ years for an everyday user. However, if you are putting your brace to extreme use – like skiing every day of the year through endless mogul fields, or surfing/sailing and not properly cleaning the salt water from your brace, your hinge may require maintenance or replacement. Full details of the warranty will be shipped with your brace(s).

Do you have questions that have not been answered here?

We’d love to hear from you! Please email us at community@springloadedtech.com and we will respond as soon as we can.

story:
This is the ReVault Smartwatch

ReVault is a new type of wearable that gives you the convenience of a smartwatch and the security of local storage. With ReVault you get everything you would expect from a smartwatch, such as notifications, custom watch faces and native apps. On top of that you get the unique ability to store your files locally and access them wherever you go at the speed of a local network. 
Pre-order a 32GB ReVault for $199 (35% off Retail)
Pre-order a 128GB ReVault for $299 (35% off Retail)

In the news


Key Features

For commuters. With a ReVault you can always access your files from anywhere, fast without a glitch, even without an Internet connection.


For travelers. Backup your files at home or on-the-go, when you need it the most. ReVault can automatically backup freshly created files on your smartphones, tablets, or computers.

For freelancers and entrepreneurs. Easy transportation of files between computers, tablets and smartphones. All your files whenever, and wherever you are without data transfer costs.

For the security-minded. The ReVault has been designed to be private, secure and protected. It functions entirely offline far out of the reach of crackers, governments and big corporations.

Only trusted devices can connect to ReVault. The data stored on ReVault is encrypted using AES-256. On top of that you can also choose to password protect your app using single, or 2-factor authentication.

For anyone that needs a boost. Do you ever run low on memory space? With a Revault you can offload files from your devices to ReVault, and access them later.

Pre-order a 32GB ReVault for $199 (35% off Retail)

Pre-order a 128GB ReVault for $299 (35% off Retail)


Referrals

Do you want to take part in our referral campaign? You must be logged in to your Indiegogo account, and use the share tools at the top of this page. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting orders.

If you ordered a 32GB you can upgrade to 128GB by simply referring 3 contributors. If you win a free ReVault through this referral campaign, you will be charged $30 for shipping and handling regardless where you live.

Benefits at a glance

ReVault connects to your devices using WiFi and Bluetooth. You can setup your ReVault to auto-backup and auto-synchronize your files across your devices. ReVault is wearable so that you can easily carry your files wherever you go at all times.

ReVault comes in the sizes of 32GB and 128GB.


Wear it your way

Revault can be worn in a variety of different ways, depending on the occasion. Revault ships with a converter that makes it possible to wear as a neck, wrist or pocket item. 

All backers get the strap of their choice

You can use a standard watch band with your Revault allowing for a large variety of options. Choose between a tapered or mesh stainless steel band, or a black leather skin when you order your Revault.

Customizable face

We provide a number of screen faces, that you can choose between. You can either select a face for your private cloud data, or a digital or analogue clock. There are also hybrid faces, displaying both. Developers will also be able to create their own custom faces using the ReVault API.


Take it for a spin


Designed for durability

ReVault has been designed with the intent to be extremely strong and durable. The case is stainless steel and water resistant. The display is in color, and protected with Corning®Gorilla ®Glass 3 with NDR™. The battery lasts for around 3 days with regular usage. ReVault is charged using a standard Qi Wireless Charger (sold separately, if you don't already own one). Charging a ReVault to 80% battery life takes 1 hour, and 100% takes 1.5 hours. 


Connect to Revault with an app

Revault is designed for simple setup and use. All the while making it possible to configure for power users. Our app runs on Android, iOS, Windows, Mac OS X and Linux. 


Technical details

  • 32GB / 128 GB
  • Bluetooth 4.0 LTE
  • WiFi b/g/n
  • Wireless (Conductive) charging Qi-standard
  • 1.54 inch, 240 × 240 pixel color display
  • Corning®Gorilla ®Glass 3 with NDR™
  • 3D accelerometer
  • Watch case: Stainless steel grade 316L


By backers for backers

We are really happy to bring this product to you. However, it would not have been possible without our 2K+ member Build Group. They have supported and guided us in every step of the way. This has helped us create a truly unique product - for backers by backers.

Perks

All ReVault include the strap of your choice, a chain converter used to wear ReVault as a pendant or keychain, and a tool for quickly swapping bands. A Qi wireless USB charger is available as a separate perk. We will add a perk for a ReVault charging stand soon.

ReVault ships world-wide. Shipping to the US is free, within the EU costs $15, and to the rest of the world $20. 

Pre-order a 32GB ReVault for $199 (35% off Retail)

Pre-order a 128GB ReVault for $299 (35% off Retail)



Timeline

We have worked really hard to minimize risk, and overcome major challenges before launching this campaign.

  • We have assembled a senior development team with long industry experience
  • We have worked close with our 2K+ Build Group community to collect as much user feedback as possible
  • All our setup costs are already covered
  • We have already reached major milestones in our hardware and software development
  • We have only selected well known components from established manufacturers

The team

We are a highly experienced team of 16 from Sweden and our members have experience building Sony smartwatches, unmanned helicopters, fighter aircraft, and automated cars with some of the world’s leading engineers and advanced technology. We have seasoned engineers, designers and entrepreneurs on board. 

FAQ

GENERAL

Who is ReVault designed for?

ReVault has been designed for casual users, as well as techies. Running it with default settings will work just fine. For the more technically inclined, there will be plenty of under-the-hood settings to tweak, based on personal preferences.

Do I need a ReVault account?

No, ReVault is a one time purchase and does not require a subscription.

What countries does ReVault ship to?

We will ship to all countries.

SPECIFICATIONS

How much storage space does ReVault have?

ReVault will be available in the sizes of 32GB and 128GB.

How long does the ReVault battery last?

The battery life lasts around 3 days, based on our hardware specification and common use case scenarios.

How is ReVault charged?

ReVault is charged using a standard Qi Wireless Charger. Charging a ReVault to 80% battery life takes 1 hour, and 100% takes 1,5 hours.

How durable is ReVault?

ReVault has a stainless steel case, and is splash and water resistant. The screen is protected using Corning®Gorilla ®Glass 3 with NDR™, which offers crack and damage resistance.

Does ReVault have an app?

We’re creating a user-friendly app for Android and IOS. The app will give you full control of your files, as well as connected devices. It will also allow you to preview your files, as well as start streaming your music & video.

Does ReVault come with different watch faces?

Yes, ReVault comes with a dozen watch faces out of the box. For example analogue to digital time, as well as vital stats for your private cloud.

What OS does ReVault have?

ReVault has a custom OS that is designed for optimal battery consumption and security.

COMMUNICATION

What platforms are compatible with ReVault?

ReVault is compatible with:

  • Android
  • IOS
  • Windows
  • Mac OS X
  • Linux

How does ReVault utilize WiFi?

ReVault can create its own WiFi network as well as join an existing one.

Can I be connected to the internet and to ReVault at the same time?

Yes, simply connect your ReVault to your local network.

Can devices completely sync as soon as they are within range of ReVault ?

Trusted devices, that have enabled auto-sync, can completely sync when they share a network with ReVault.

Does ReVault sync with existing cloud services?

ReVault does not connect to the Internet for security reasons. If you want to sync your files to online public cloud services, you can continue to do so from your computer. 

SECURITY

How does ReVault secure your data?

ReVault is designed to securely strap to your body. It works securely offline. Only trusted devices can connect to ReVault. The data stored on ReVault is encrypted using AES-256. On top of that you can also choose to password protect your app using single, or 2-factor authentication.

Is the data sent to and from ReVault encrypted?

Yes.

What happens if my ReVault is lost or stolen?

The data on your ReVault will be very difficult to steal, because it is always encrypted and password protected. You can auto-backup ReVault itself to another device, for example a NAS, to store changed files from last time.

DESIGN

In what ways can I wear ReVault?

ReVault can be worn as a wrist, neck or pocket item. It ships with a chain converter that makes it possible to swap between straps or a chain.

Are ReVault straps standard sized and swappable?

ReVault uses standard sized straps. There are 3 straps to choose from: tapered stainless steel, mesh stainless steel, as well as black leather calf. We also ship a tool that makes it easy for you to swap straps at home.


Contact

For press inquiries please contact team@revault.io
story_txt:
This is the ReVault Smartwatch








ReVault is a new type of wearable that gives you the convenience of a smartwatch and the security of local storage. With ReVault you get everything you would expect from a smartwatch, such as notifications, custom watch faces and native apps. On top of that you get the unique ability to store your files locally and access them wherever you go at the speed of a local network. 
Pre-order a 32GB ReVault for $199 (35% off Retail)Pre-order a 128GB ReVault for $299 (35% off Retail)
In the news







   Key Features







For commuters. With a ReVault you can always access your files from anywhere, fast without a glitch, even without an Internet connection.




For travelers. Backup your files at home or on-the-go, when you need it the most. ReVault can automatically backup freshly created files on your smartphones, tablets, or computers.


For freelancers and entrepreneurs. Easy transportation of files between computers, tablets and smartphones. All your files whenever, and wherever you are without data transfer costs.








For the security-minded. The ReVault has been designed to be private, secure and protected. It functions entirely offline far out of the reach of crackers, governments and big corporations.
Only trusted devices can connect to ReVault. The data stored on ReVault is encrypted using AES-256. On top of that you can also choose to password protect your app using single, or 2-factor authentication.





For anyone that needs a boost. Do you ever run low on memory space? With a Revault you can offload files from your devices to ReVault, and access them later.



Pre-order a 32GB ReVault for $199 (35% off Retail)
Pre-order a 128GB ReVault for $299 (35% off Retail)




Referrals
Do you want to take part in our referral campaign? You must be logged in to your Indiegogo account, and use the share tools at the top of this page. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting orders.
If you ordered a 32GB you can upgrade to 128GB by simply referring 3 contributors. If you win a free ReVault through this referral campaign, you will be charged $30 for shipping and handling regardless where you live.



Benefits at a glance


ReVault connects to your devices using WiFi and Bluetooth. You can setup your ReVault to auto-backup and auto-synchronize your files across your devices. ReVault is wearable so that you can easily carry your files wherever you go at all times.
ReVault comes in the sizes of 32GB and 128GB.



Wear it your way



Revault can be worn in a variety of different ways, depending on the occasion. Revault ships with a converter that makes it possible to wear as a neck, wrist or pocket item. 


All backers get the strap of their choice


You can use a standard watch band with your Revault allowing for a large variety of options. Choose between a tapered or mesh stainless steel band, or a black leather skin when you order your Revault.


Customizable face

We provide a number of screen faces, that you can choose between. You can either select a face for your private cloud data, or a digital or analogue clock. There are also hybrid faces, displaying both. Developers will also be able to create their own custom faces using the ReVault API.

Take it for a spin






Designed for durability






ReVault has been designed with the intent to be extremely strong and durable. The case is stainless steel and water resistant. The display is in color, and protected with Corning®Gorilla ®Glass 3 with NDR™. The battery lasts for around 3 days with regular usage. ReVault is charged using a standard Qi Wireless Charger (sold separately, if you don't already own one). Charging a ReVault to 80% battery life takes 1 hour, and 100% takes 1.5 hours. 





Connect to Revault with an app
Revault is designed for simple setup and use. All the while making it possible to configure for power users. Our app runs on Android, iOS, Windows, Mac OS X and Linux. 







Technical details

32GB / 128 GB

Bluetooth 4.0 LTE


WiFi b/g/n

Wireless (Conductive) charging Qi-standard
1.54 inch, 240 × 240 pixel color display

Corning®Gorilla ®Glass 3 with NDR™
3D accelerometer

Watch case: Stainless steel grade 316L



By backers for backers













We are really happy to bring this product to you. However, it would not have been possible without our 2K+ member Build Group. They have supported and guided us in every step of the way. This has helped us create a truly unique product - for backers by backers.






Perks
All ReVault include the strap of your choice, a chain converter used to wear ReVault as a pendant or keychain, and a tool for quickly swapping bands. A Qi wireless USB charger is available as a separate perk. We will add a perk for a ReVault charging stand soon.









ReVault ships world-wide. Shipping to the US is free, within the EU costs $15, and to the rest of the world $20. 


Pre-order a 32GB ReVault for $199 (35% off Retail)
Pre-order a 128GB ReVault for $299 (35% off Retail)




Timeline


We have worked really hard to minimize risk, and overcome major challenges before launching this campaign.

We have assembled a senior development team with long industry experience
We have worked close with our 2K+ Build Group community to collect as much user feedback as possible
All our setup costs are already covered
We have already reached major milestones in our hardware and software development
We have only selected well known components from established manufacturers



The team





We are a highly experienced team of 16 from Sweden and our members have experience building Sony smartwatches, unmanned helicopters, fighter aircraft, and automated cars with some of the world’s leading engineers and advanced technology. We have seasoned engineers, designers and entrepreneurs on board. 


 
FAQ



GENERAL

story: Doyle Tucker has been diagnosed with a fast-growing malignant brain tumor. His children are working on collecting funds to cover expenses associated with his care, including travel to & from Vancouver, BC where he resides.

story:
THE CAMPAIGN CONTINUES AT LEROUXED.COM

THANK YOU AGAIN EVERYBODY WHO HAS SUPPORTED THIS FIRST FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN AND/OR MY PHASE II CAMPAIGN!

***** CLICK HERE TO SEE PHASE II CAMPAIGN NOW! *****

WE REACHED 17% OF OUR PHASE II CAMPAIGN AND SECURED A LEGAL TEAM TO GO TO THE BC COURT OF APPEAL AND DEFEND THE DUTY OF CARE FOR ALL TAXPAYERS!   THANK YOU AND PLEASE WATCH FOR UPDATES!

Funds raised ARE helping to support Irvin in his legal battle that will benefit us all.

---- JUSTICE costs money!  The campaign attracted the attention of leading law firms, legal resources and tax litigators across the country and this is very exciting!   Here's an excerpt from Karen Selick's  Our Tax Hero Needs A Lawyer letter citing her discussion with a leading Toronto tax litigator: "many of his clients have suffered financial disaster like Leroux's following an audit by the CRA....If he had been the judge, he said, he would have immediately understood how the large penalties and liens imposed upon Leroux had led to his financial difficulties...."

I posted this video under UPDATES on this page to explain where we are at in the battle - please check it out along with the other UPDATES and COMMENTS!

The duty of care decision is only halfway to holding CRA accountable.  The other half is making them pay.  We have appealed the decision because it didn't go far enough for me or for Canadian taxpayers.  The CRA has cross-appealed because a) they want me to pay their costs and b) they want to challenge the duty of care that was won in my case that now holds CRA accountable to Canadian taxpayers.

Above is a picture of me, Irvin Leroux, my lawyer and  our law student who battled the massive Department of Justice team during a 14 day trial last October 2013.  It was a true David v Goliath scene.  I have been fighting the taxman (Leroux v Canada Revenue Agency) for 18 years because of a rogue and incorrect audit that started in 1996.  Details of how I lost everything can be found here.  

Here is a short video introduction of my story

Over the years I have heard hundreds of sickening, heart-breaking and tragic stories about how the all powerful taxman - 55,000 strong - has destroyed families, businesses, and no one can hold them accountable. 

As one experienced tax lawyer told me after the decision, "your situation is pretty regular unfortunately; you're dealing with appeals [officers] who have no accountability and you're dealing with auditors who have no accountability." This isn't right in our democracy, in our country of Canada.  Everybody knows somebody who knows somebody with a taxman horror story.

I have done everything possible abiding the system, to fight for what is right.  CRA said I owed them a million bucks but they were wrong (the judge said very wrong) and after I took them to the Tax Court of Canada and filed a Fairness Application, CRA owed me $24,000! (which I never saw).  After the trial in the Fall, we got the judge's decision on April 30 2014 and I won an incredible victory - the judge said CRA owed me a duty of care and this has now set a precedent for all Canadian taxpayers past, present and future!

Tax lawyers all across the country are jumping for joy...
...but this fight has cost me everything and I still have no restitution.

As one tax lawyer states "all the big firms have written about the duty of care [decision] - it is a very big deal for all of us and all Canadian taxpayers."

This campaign is about full justice and holding CRA fully accountable.

Here is what duty of care means

We're halfway to Justice and Accountability

The duty of care decision is only halfway to holding CRA accountable.  The other half is making them pay. We have appealed the decision because it didn't go far enough for me or for Canadian taxpayers.

The CRA has cross-appealed because they want me to pay their costs and in my experience they will challenge the duty of care holding them accountable.

  • We need $15,500 to cover the cost of the transcript for the 14 day trial 
    CHECK
  • We don't have a choice but to purchase this because it is a rule of the court CHECK
  • The transcript is an intimate, accurate invaluable account of what was said by the judge, by the lawyers and all witnesses (the government called eleven of them)
  • CHECK - THE WHOLE TRUTH AND JUSTICE WILL PREVAIL

The Impact

JUSTICE costs money!  The government has spent hundreds of thousands of dollars to fight me.  CRA never let me forget it has unlimited resources to fight me.  All funds raised in this campaign will go to pay for the transcript first; if we raise more than this goal, funds will cover other court costs, document costs and legal fees and in the end, this victory will continue to help all Canadians

  • I don't want millions of dollars from the government
  • I just want back what CRA misfeasance and negligence caused me to lose
  • We need legal expertise to help get restitution and damages 
  • We have already been successful in over ten motions and my case has set the precedent for duty of care by CRA but we need to ensure it stays


    This case is making a difference for everyone

     18 years is a long time to fight.  I have survived motions to dismiss my case, changes in legal counsel and pled with five Ministers of National Revenue who know my story but have done nothing to support justice and accountability.

    This battle is for my family, my grandkids, my friends and neighbours and so many other Canadians who have found themselves up against the behemoth agency. ....  Unless there is  a consequence for actions, there is no deterrent and this is what we need to show CRA.  David beat Goliath because David stuck to what he knew best and Goliath didn't adapt.  

    Systemic change takes time and money - 21 million tax returns were filed last year - this campaign is meaningful for every one of us that filed one!   If you are:

     - Generation X or Generation Y

    - a working baby boomer

    - bank lawyers and accountants

    - a pensioner

    - a nurse

    - a teacher

    - a small business owner (like I was)

    - a big organization

    - a student!!

    - an auto worker

    - a tax lawyer

    - a truck driver

    - a celebrity

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute financially, thank you so much for reading this page and we would sure appreciate if you could:

    • phone or write to your MP in support of the Duty of Care

    • Contact the Prime Minister directly to Stand Up for Taxpayers!

    • share this story using the Indiegogo share tools

    • spread the word about Duty of Care!!! just ask your accountant or lawyer,  google "leroux duty of care" to see it is a big deal!

    THANK YOU TO ALL SUPPORTERS, FAMILY, FRIENDS,  AND EVERYONE WHO HAS HELPED ME ALONG THE WAY DOWN THIS LONG ROAD TO JUSTICE AND ACCOUNTABILITY.  ONE MORE ROUND TO GO!

This battle is for my family, my grandkids, my friends and neighbours and so many other Canadians who have found themselves up against the behemoth agency. ....  Unless there is  a consequence for actions, there is no deterrent and this is what we need to show CRA.  David beat Goliath because David stuck to what he knew best and Goliath didn't adapt.  Systemic change takes time and money - 21 million tax returns were filed last year - this campaign is meaningful for every one of us that filed one!   If you are: - Generation X or Generation Y- a working baby boomer- bank lawyers and accountants- a pensioner- a nurse- a teacher- a small business owner (like I was)- a big organization- a student!!- an auto worker- a tax lawyer- a truck driver- a celebrityOther Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially, thank you so much for reading this page and we would sure appreciate if you could:

story:
Overview

One of the most powerful typhoons ever recorded in history slammed Tacloban, Philippines early Friday, November 8, 2013 causing catastrophic damages, destroying homes,displacing families, children, creating casualties estimated to rise over 10,000 and leaving children and hundred's of thousand residence without food, water, shelter, clothing and basic medical care.

Devastating images from Tacloban, Philippines showed streets under waist-deep floodwater carrying debris that had been blown down by the fierce winds. Bodies of victims drowned by the storm surge are lying on the streets, roads, and underneath debris.

Background

My name is Aisa Nguyen Aigbe, I grew up in Tacloban, Philippines where the super Typhoon Haiyan hit the most. My mother, a Vietnam War survivor, father, 3 siblings and a Nephew, luckily all survived super Typhoon Haiyan. I was moved to start this campaign after watching countless images on TV of dead loved ones, Children, Mothers, and Families whose homes were completely destroyed, lost loved ones and everything they owned. I'm asking for donations from anyone reading this campaign. Nothing is too small. Even $1 or less will make a difference in a child's life in Tacloban, Philippines. I want to help my fellow Filipinos and my hometown residence in Tacloban. I have plenty of good memories from my childhood days growing up in Tacloban, Philippines. Its a small town where everyone knows' each other. If you were moved by the countless images of total devastation on TV, coming out of Tacloban, Philippines, I am asking for your support. Support this campaign and restore families, children and mothers back to their feet. Thanks for your generous support.

Video Link

http://www.cnn.com/video/data/2.0/video/world/2...

Images

Below is an image of children, mothers and families displaced by the catastrophic Typhoon Haiyan seeking help.

Below is an image of police authorities collecting bodies lying on the streets of Tacloban after super typhoon Yolanda (Haiyan) hit the city. Tacloban City is now under a state of calamity.

Below is an image of residents of Tacloban City siphon gasoline from a local gas station. Tacloban City is now under state of calamity.

Below is an image of an old lady walking toward downtown Tacloban City despite her frail health, joining thousands who were affected by super typhoon Yolanda (Haiyan). People from as far as Samar are going to Tacloban City looking for relief and basic necesities.

Below is an image of residents of Tacloban from all walks of life line up to fetch water being provided by the local water district. Tacloban residents try to cope with whatever is available after the storm surge destroyed basic services in the city.

Below is an image of helpless Tacloban residents waiting patiently for basic life necessities, food, water, shelter, clothing, and medical care.

What We Need

We are asking for any donations to operate a free Food Center, Rebuild Homes, provide Clothing, and basic Medical Assistant  for Survivors of super Typoon Haiyan in Tacloban City, Philippines. I know the logistics of the area very well and will with local community leaders to help restores as many Tacloban City residence as possible, who lost everything they own and are still suffering from the devastation caused by the storm.  We are looking for sponsorships to pay for the free Food Center, basic Medical Care, Homes Rebuilding effort, and Clothing to communities in Tacloban City that were most affected by Typhoon Haiyan.

  • We are hoping to raise $8,000 to make this campaign a reality.
  • All the money raised from this campaign will go towards Food, Medical Care, Homes Rebuilding, and Clothing for survivors of Typhoon Haiyan in Tacloban, Philippines.

The Impact

Many communities around Tacloban City have been entirely destroyed by Typoon Haiyan. A hot meal, basic medical care, clothing and homes rebuilding is a small way to help Tacloban, Philippines residence have a moment of comfort.

  • We can move fast and get help out to those who need it quickly.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out about our campaign.

I was moved to start this campaign after watching countless images on TV of dead loved ones, Children, Mothers, and Families whose homes were completely destroyed, lost loved ones and everything they owned. I'm asking for donations from
anyone reading this campaign. Nothing is too small. Even $1 or less will make a difference in a child's life in Tacloban, Philippines. I want to help my fellow Filipinos and my hometown residence in Tacloban. I have plenty of good memories from my childhood days growing up in 
Tacloban, Philippines. Its a small town where everyone knows' each other. If you were moved by the countless images of total devastation on TV, coming out of Tacloban, Philippines, I am asking for your support. Support this campaign and restore families, children and mothers back to their feet. Thanks for your generous support.Video Linkhttp://www.cnn.com/video/data/2.0/video/world/2...ImagesBelow is an image of children, mothers and families displaced by the catastrophic Typhoon Haiyan seeking help.Below is an image of police authorities collecting bodies lying on the streets of Tacloban after super 
typhoon Yolanda (Haiyan) hit the city. Tacloban City is now under a state of calamity.Below is an image of residents of Tacloban City siphon gasoline from a local gas station. Tacloban 
City is now under state of calamity.Below is an image of an old lady walking toward downtown Tacloban City 
despite her frail health, joining thousands who were affected by super typhoon 
Yolanda (Haiyan). People from as far as Samar are going to Tacloban City 
looking for relief and basic necesities. Below is an image of residents of Tacloban from all walks of life line 
up to fetch water being provided by the local water district. Tacloban 
residents try to cope with whatever is available after the storm surge destroyed 
basic services in the city. Below is an image of helpless Tacloban residents waiting patiently for basic life necessities, food, water, shelter, clothing, and medical care.
What We Need
We are asking for any donations to operate a free Food Center, Rebuild Homes, provide Clothing, and basic Medical Assistant  for Survivors of super Typoon Haiyan in Tacloban City, Philippines. I know the logistics of the area very well and will with local community leaders to help restores as many Tacloban City residence as possible, who lost everything they own and are still 
suffering from the devastation caused by the storm.  We are looking for sponsorships to pay for the free Food Center, basic Medical Care, Homes Rebuilding effort, and Clothing to communities in Tacloban City that were most 
affected by Typhoon Haiyan.  
We are hoping to raise $8,000 to make this campaign a reality.

All the money raised from this campaign will go towards Food, Medical Care, Homes Rebuilding, and Clothing for survivors of Typhoon Haiyan in Tacloban, Philippines.


The ImpactMany communities around Tacloban City have been entirely destroyed by Typoon Haiyan. A hot meal, basic medical care, clothing and homes rebuilding is a small way to help Tacloban, Philippines residence have a moment of comfort.
We can move fast and get help out to those who need it quickly.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Please get the word out about our campaign.

story:
AUM Love is a community based in conscious living.

In essence AUM Love is dedicated to:

  • Benefiting and serving life through personal and collective spiritual expansion.
  • Allocating material resources towards sustainable living practices, and physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual healing, rather than the unconscious practices of war, unhealthy living, selfish material pursuit, or any other model of commerce that does not take into consideration the health and happiness of all life.
  • Rebalancing the collective consciousness through awareness of the Divine Feminine.
  • The unity and harmony of all religion and spirituality in Love.
  • A healthy, peaceful, happy, and harmonious existence with the Earth Mother and her inhabitants.

 

We see the essence of all religion and spirituality as Love, and offer information and practices on yoga, meditation, healthy eating, and overall conscious living as a way of realizing this divine Love.

We would like to establish a fully sustainable healing retreat center, where community members and retreatants would live simple, fulfilling, service-based lives, and receive free healing sessions that would include massage, reiki, yoga/meditation instruction, sound healing, creative expression, and anything else that inspires Love.

We feel that it is unnatural for our food source to be far away from our living space, and for our entertainment technology to be more easily accessible. It is unnatural for any agenda to exist that does not take into consideration the peace and happiness of all Life. We would therefore like to provide the opportunity for humans to live in a simple, sustainable, harmonious, and peaceful way upon the Earth, and come into their highest spiritual and creative potential. We focus especially on healing females as a contribution to planetary balance, as the Earth is currently under a masculine-dominant imalance

Our community encompasses many of the categories on Indiegogo such as music, religion, writing, art, food, photography, environment/technology, education, health, and dance. In essence we are developing a sustainable community based in conscious living and spiritual expansion.

In a community setting we would produce and offer music, poetry, and healing sessions for free.

 

Here are some of the categories on Indiegogo that we fit into:

 

Music:

We all enjoy a wide variety of music, and love to produce both acoustically and electronically. The music we channel is a blend of ancient Eastern spirituality, tribal/shamanic cultures, and contemporary, intelligent electronic music. We are also experimenting with using different healing frequencies in electronic music, and incorporating the healing tones of instruments like crystal sound bowls and pan drums. Our intention, when support has given us some stability, is to produce and release free healing music.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W7iz2TPm9Ug&feature=plcp

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lLPqEG7pxCs&feature=relmfu

http://www.soundcloud.com/serenadevi



Religion:

Having studied many religions and one of us having received a BA in Religion, it is our main interest in life to unite all beings under Love, which is the true source, purpose, and end to all religious pursuit. We practice meditation and other techniques from a variety of cultures and resonate with anything that brings awareness to one's Soul essence.

Yoga page on Aum Love-

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=111



Writing:

All of us enjoy writing blogs, articles, and poetry, and are looking for an opportunity to be able to offer our writings to the world for free. We like to write about practical spirituality, give tips on healthy living, and channel divinely inspired poetry.

See examples here-

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=2057



Health:

Everything we do at AUM Love is to promote a healthy life, both internally and externally. When we are contacting our soul's joy through meditation, feeding our body lovingly with high energy foods, and contributing to the happiness of others through our daily service, we exist in a pure state of life, full of Love.

The ways we come into full health are through dietary cleansing, massage, reiki/energy healing, yoga, meditation, communing with Nature, and any other natural inclinations of the Soul.

Healing Arts page-

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=207



Art:

Art represents the creative potency of life. As spiritual beings, it is natural for us to create spontaneously from the Love in our hearts. We encourage art and any other creative expression that allows us an outlet for spiritual expression and expansion, uplifting and inspiring others at the same time.



Food:

The diet we practice is an organic, live-food diet. We have found this diet most conducive to spiritual awakening as it provides immediate usable energy, does not weigh the body down unnecessarily, and gives us beauty and longevity. Living foods also provide us with the most nutrients and enzymes possible, as the food's life-force is still fully intact.

On retreat, we would like to transition people onto a mostly raw diet. On our website we offer diet tips and recipes.

See our Soulfood page on Aum Love- http://aumlove.org/?page_id=326



Photography:

As amateur photographers, our website has inspired us to take many photos and we have fallen in love with capturing Life on film.

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=1457



Environment/technology:

The retreat center we are planning would be fully sustainable. We currently are focused on one main interest, a retreat center close to our area that is run on solar power, has a well for fresh water, and is under land conservation, ensuring the area stays pristine.

As Earth and her inhabitants shift into a more harmonious way of life, green, ego-friendly technology helps us to thrive in a healthy and loving relationship with our planet and global society.

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=245



Education:

All of the spiritual paths and traditions we have studied have offered us an abundance of information that would be our joy to share with others. AUM Love knows that each Soul has the same infinite potential, and we would like all community members to be adept in any and all subjects that are inspiring and helpful to the community and planet. Studying and growing in subjects such as gardening, yoga, and crafting allows us to create a viable, sustainable, and loving community,



Dance:

Dance is one of the main ways we express the freedom of spirit and joy of life. It is a deep spiritual practice, that is a main focus of our community.


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sdo4G96ZJ2c&feature=plcp

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3HePRmLL8H4&...



Video/web:

We recently launched our website, aumlove.org, which we will be updating from time to time with articles, blogs, poetry, recipes, and videos.

We are also developing a website on the ancient spiritual path of Tantra that we will most likely be launching this month.



Our website- http://www.aumlove.org
Coming soon- http://www.aumlovetantra.com

What We Need & What You Get

$5,400

This initial sum of money we are asking for is to cover our current living costs, so that we are able to start producing free healing music and giving free healing sessions. Other than living costs, $1500 would initially go towards musical instruments and minor recording equipment. With rent covered, we would be able to spend more time networking for the establishment of a permanent AUM Love retreat center, and developing our websites that offer information on conscious living.

We have established the limit as a way of ensuring our immediate stability, yet our main focus is to expand our practice and establish a permanent retreat center. Contributing to living costs helps us to be stable enough to continue networking and producing media, and is the main point of this campaign, however, if the opportunity arises for us to be go directly into a permanent center or a larger center that would allow us to expand our practices, this would be ideal, and so excess funding past our limit is welcome.

Please visit:

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=985

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=1068

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=1022

http://aumlove.org/?page_id=1015

 

The Impact

Our generation is in the position to change the way humans live upon Mother Earth. We see the way material resources are being funneled out into vanity, war, and other harmful causes, and would like a chance to do something positive with it instead. We intend to establish a fully sustainable healing retreat center with fresh well water, solar power, and insulated building materials, in which our community would be able to grow and preserve its own organic food/medicine in a greenhouse, learn yoga, meditation and healthy diet, and develop individual and group creative talents.

All of these efforts stem from the idea that Love is the core essence of all religion and spirituality, and at AUM Love, we resonate with any discipline or practice that inspires love and the service of all Life. We have been given the information and lifestyle necessary to provide people with simple and satisfying lives based in spiritual expansion. We intend to develop a template for conscious living that this and other generations can emulate.

We also understand that the planet is being ruled by aggressive masculine mentalities, and wish to contribute to shifting consciousness through the information and retreats we offer.

If you resonate with our cause please contribute by investing or sharing the message. Email aumloveorg@gmail.com to contact us, and visit the website www.aumlove.org for more in-depth information about us and our vision.


*AUM*

story:
What's This All About?

For those of you who know me, my name is Elif and I am a 5th year medical student at UNSW. As part of my medical elective I have the privilege to travel to countries far less privileged than we are at home. I will be spending four weeks in December in a small hospital near Mount Meru in a town called Arusha - which is located inland in Tanzania, close to the Serengeti. 

 

The hospital here like many hospitals in Africa relies heavily on NGOs and foreign aid for funding of supplies and equipment, and often many of the medical problems faced no longer exist in the first world. I am hoping to be able to make a small difference by contributing back to the hospital I am placed at, and have the unique advantage of seeing first hand what items are really needed. 

 

What We Need & The Impact

Every dollar counts, but the more money raised the more lasting contribution we are able to make to the hospital. If we are able to raise a more sizable contribution the majority of money will go to purchasing equipment that is much needed by the hospital, otherwise various smaller items such as medication and bandages will be bought. All of the money fundraised will be used to purchase medical supplies and equipment from the local Medical Stores Department (you can access their catalogue and price list here http://www.msd.or.tz). One of the benfits to purchasing item in Tanzania, is supporting the local manufacturers and suppliers as well as doing away with unnecessary costs for postage and customs, meaning all the money goes directly to funding items much needed by the hospital. Here is a bit of an example of what your contribution could buy:

 

$1              Thermometer

$5              Mosquito Net

$10           50 IV Cannulas

$15           100 Pairs of Sterile Surgical Gloves

$20           1000 Tablets of Amoxicillin (Antibiotic)

$25           Stethoscope

$50           Sphygmomanometer (BP Machine)

$150         Hospital Bed

Another example of the impact you can have is in treating malaria, it costs only $10 for treatment with Quinine a drug to treat Malaria and only $5 for a Mosquito net which is the best prevention. In 2010, there were about 216 million malaria cases and over half a million malaria deaths, 90% of which occurred in the African Region, mostly among children under five years of age. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you aren’t able to help - if you can forward this on to friends and family, or click on the like/share buttons that would be great!

story:
Hi everyone. My name is Christine Mancusi. I'm starting a fundraising campaign on behalf of my amazing future sister in law, Nicole Groshong.

The Fundraiser is to provide Nicole with 2 fantastic wigs while she endures chemotherapy treatment for breast cancer.

The campaign is called, "I Care for Nicole's Hair."

http://igg.me/p/243024?a=1160904

 

This is Nicole's story.  (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KRXHwvyZAC0)

On June 30th, after 3 years of dating, Nicole and my younger brother Tom got engaged. On July 30th Nicole was diagnosed with a very rare and aggressive form of breast cancer called clear cell cancer. On August 20th she had a double mastectomy. On October 8th she starts her first of 8 chemotherapy treatments. She is 27 years old. 

I want to give you an example of the type of person Nicole is. The day she was having her double mastectomy surgery, she was lying in bed waiting for the surgeon. Her mom was in the room with her. I came in to visit her. We were talking and she said to me "I'm sorry I'm a little grumpy today." and as she was being wheeled off to surgery, she was waving to my brother with a smile and saying I love you. She is just amazing. 

I couldn't even imagine how I would deal with the magnitude of something like this. She is so brave and positive and so full of love. She is a light that makes this world a brighter place.

My mom as well as several family members are breast cancer survivors. The more people I talk with about this, the more I realize that just about everyone knows someone affected by breast cancer. Because Nicole's cancer was so aggressive and rare, had she waited, the diagnosis would have been terminal. Nicole's cancer was detected in the infancy stages. With her double mastectomy surgery and  chemotherapy treatment, she now has an 86% chance of survival.

Whether it's a dollar or a hundred dollars, every donation counts and every donation is gratefully appreciated. What's equally important is to pass on the story. Spread the word. Share your story with Nicole. Offer your words of encouragement. Pass on Nicole's story. It may just help someone with early detection. Early detection saves lives. Early detection saved Nicole's life.

I'm trying to raise $5000. This amount will buy 2 wigs made of human hair. It will look the most realistic and feel the most comfortable. With all she has been thrown, she at least deserves to have a wig that makes her feel at ease.

We have 3 very personalized breast cancer awareness perks we are offering.

At the $25 contribution you will receive a pink band with "I Care for Nicole's Hair" inscribed.

At the $50 contribution you will receive a white t-shirt with my original designed girl drawing silk-screened on the front and "I Care for Nicole's Hair" on the back. 

At the $100 contribution you will receive a custom made breast cancer awareness birch candle. These candles are all one of a kind, hand made by my mom. Trying to describe them does them no justice. They are beautiful.

Follow Nicole's progress on facebook. www.facebook.com/icarefornicoleshair

So this is my heartfelt fundraiser to provide Nicole with 2 fantastic wigs to allow her to feel a bit more normal and dignified during this awful chapter in her life.

story:
Short Summary

I am a Certified Counsellor (Canadian Counselling and Psychotherapy Association) with over 20 years experience in human services. In that time I have been witness to and experienced myself what is known as "compassion fatigue" and burnout. Helpers in the field have big hearts and a passion for helping and contributing to others. The demands of this work and the lower remuneration and benefits that these jobs typically offer are barriers to consistent self-care and, as a result, long-term wellness. 

For this reason, turnover and rates of burnout and compassion fatigue in human services is very high.

We all want the most skilled, compassionate and experienced helpers to be there for our loved ones when needed, so what can we do to help?

Research clearly identifies self care and supportive connections as key protective and restorative factors in preventing and recovering from burnout and compassion fatigue.

Rolling Hills Health and Wellness Retreat is a two day intensive retreat for helpers in human services that provides an invaluable foundation of self-care experience, knowledge and support that is easily integrated into ongoing practice and a way of life. This enables helpers to continue contributing with care and passion to others.

Your contribution to this campaign not only supports helpers who attend the retreat, but the many people they support and help as well. In other words, you will be contributing to the health and well-being of potentially 10, 20, 100 (or more) people.  Talk about a viral effect!

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign goal is $4750 to make this retreat happen. This includes: 

     -$2000 for lodging, meals and meeting room rentals

     -$1000 for practitioners, teachers and session leaders

     -$1000 for one massage for each participant by a Certified Massage Therapist

     -$650 for additional supplies, administration fees and taxes

In addition to making a difference in the lives of countless people, those of you who can contribute $25 or more will receive a summary of anonymous impact statements from participants. Contributors of $100 or more will receive an autographed music CD that includes the song Rolling Hills from the campaign video. Those who contribute $1000 or more will also have their name and/or company name identified as a sponsor of the retreat on printed and visual documents during the retreat.

Rest assured that all contributions made will go toward the retreat. If the target fundraising goal is not met, the retreat will go ahead. I am committed to making this happen!

The Impact

We've all experienced the care and support of a helper at some time in our life when we most needed it. This is our opportunity to pay it forward and make sure skilled, compassionate and experienced helpers are there for others who need them. 

I have extensive experience organizing/leading groups and retreats as well as 10 years specializing in resilience. Those who participate will come away with an incredible foundation of self-care experience and knowledge that transforms lives and leads to long-term health and well-being.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can’t contribute but believe in this project, you can help by passing this along to others who can. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
http:www.moringasmoothies.com

I have had tremendous physical/mental improvement from using the supplements Moringa and Stevia.  I first went to Moringa to gain more energy.  I was tired of just pumping in more caffeine or other 'energy' drinks.  One shot of Moringa and I was ready to conquer the world.  But, Moringa did so much more for me.  My blood pressure went down, my blood sugar stabilized, I slept better, mental clarity went off the charts, I could see better, the list goes on and on.
It is truly the Superfood as raved about on Dr. Oz, NBC News, the Discovery Channel, and many others.

FROM THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF HEALTH STUDY -  The two-way ANOVA showed that the two main effects of fresh Moringa and time course, and also the interaction (Moringa and time course) were significant (p<0.05) for blood glucose changes. Moringa significantly decreased blood glucose at 20, 30, 45, and 60 min (p<0.05) compared to the control.

Dried Moringa powder is very difficult to use.  It doesn't taste good and it is gritty.  What I have done is use fresh Moringa leaves.  Fresh Moringa is similar in taste to other greens, but packs a world of important nutrients.  I mix these into my smoothies to give you the benefits of this true Superfood.  Moringa cannot be heated above 118 degrees F. or it will lose much of its value.  Thus, fresh-tasting smoothies are the best answer.

I am now ready to bring the recipes I've used to the public through stores that will offer great tasting Moringa Smoothies and Teas -- sweetened with Stevia.  I need to raise money to open the first of many stores.  These stores will be in airports, malls, shopping centers and other high traffic locations everywhere.

I have put the whole plan on our MoringaSmoothies.com website, but here are some important facts about what Moringa contains:

Huge amount of Protein, 46 Antioxidants, 36 Anti-Inflammatories

Vitamins: A (Alpha and Beta-Carotene), B, B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B12, C, D, E, K, Folic Acid, Biotin and more.

Minerals: Calcium, Chloride, Chromium, Copper, Fluorine, Iron, Manganese, Magnesium, Molybdenum, Phosphorus, Potassium, Sodium, Selenium, Sulfur, Zinc.

All 8 Essential Amino Acids: Isoleucine, Leucine, Lysine, Methionine, Phenylalanine,
Threonine, Tryptophan, Valine.· 
10 Additional Amino Acids: Alanine, Arganine, Aspartic Acid, Cystine, Glutamine, Glycine, Histidine, Proline, Serine, Tyrosine.
Other Beneficial Nutrients: Chlorophyll, Carotenoids, Cytokinins, Flavonoids, Omega (3, 6, 9) oils, Plant Sterols, Polyphenols, Lutein, Xanthins, Rutin, and more.

 

 I believe Moringa will do more for your well-being than virtually any other food. We make it convenient, great tasting, and affordable.
The special combination of the magnesium and vitamin B alone will give you more energy than you can imagine. Plus, our smoothies are 100% natural with no artificial ingredients and are gluten-free.

We are assembling an expert staff to help us open the stores and franchise Moringa Smoothies everywhere.  The menu will feature at least 75 exciting, wonderful flavors plus great tasting teas.  The stores will be bright and airy.  We will offer free samples and free Wi-Fi.  These stores will be a relaxing gathering place for people intent on getting the most out of life.  The seating will be comfortable and the staff attendant.

I make no claims that Moringa will benefit you the way it did for me or that you will receive any benefits, but here is a recent picture of me.  Supplying proper nutrients to your body will do wonders.

 I will be 70 years old next May (Born in 1944).  Here's my Facebook page- https://www.facebook.com/joe.shepard.1694 -

 

Help me open these stores and be part of a move to better health and a better life.

 

Note:  If we do not raise enough money to open at least one store, we will extend credits towards the purchase of Moringa powder, teas, and/or capsules to those who did contribute.  We will also have an extensive line of premium USDA Certified Organic Moringa products.

story:
Helping me fund my Ex-Wife's Funeral Expenses.

Right now we don't have much lead on what really happened because it is still under investigation but we know that she was hit by a car and tragically killed.


She was left in a comma for 5 days, with broken ribs, a broken pelvis and an injury in her spine. She never woke up.

We found out about her death on Thursday morning, May 2nd. She leaves behind 4 children.

Any contribution would help to pay for funeral costs. Thank you so much and God Bless you!
story_txt:
Helping me fund my Ex-Wife's Funeral Expenses.
Right now we don't have much lead on what really happened because it is still under investigation but we know that she was hit by a car and tragically killed.
She was left in a comma for 5 days, with broken ribs, a broken pelvis and an injury in her spine. She never woke up.
We found out about her death on Thursday morning, May 2nd. She leaves behind 4 children.
Any contribution would help to pay for funeral costs. Thank you so much and God Bless you!

story:
Brian was in a four wheeler accident. He punctured his lung, broke his ribs, broke his collar bone and is heavily sedated in ICU at St Mary's trying to recover. $500 buys lab fees, $10 buys an aspirin at his intensive care suite. 

It's not going to be a cheap accident and He'd hate asking for help, but let's try to help him out financially if you can. He's self employed.

story:
www.DiviPill.com

HAVE YOU OR A LOVED ONE STRUGGLED WITH TAKING MEDICATION ON TIME?

Help bring DIVI™ Technology to you and your loved ones.

TELL US WHAT YOU THINK! Click Here






All of your Pills in one DEVICE...

Simply put, DIVI™ is an intelligent, easy to use pill dispenser: 


  1. Dispenses 1-10 different medications at once* 
  2. Communicates with family, friends and/or caregivers by txt and/or email**
  3. Easily creates customizable reports for you and your physician**


*based on an industry standard 500mg size "0" capsule/pill.
**This feature requires a computer and WiFi connected DIVI, but is not required to utilize many of DIVI's other amazing features.

How DIVI Works

1. Load

Pills are placed into the seperate chambers of a "DIVI Cartridge". The Cartridge is then inserted in to the DIVI Dispenser. 

2. Select

Your profile/pill schedule is selected from the DIVI touch screen interface.

3. Dispense

DIVI dispenses medication according to schedule, unless the previous medication has not been taken. This would cause an "alert".

4. Alert

DIVI can contact family and/or caregivers via text and email. The device owner decides the parameters that initiate an ALERT. 


ALERT FAMILY, FRIENDS, AND/OR CAREGIVERS



REPORTS

Create easy to comprehend reports so you and your doctors can make decisions based on actual data.



DIVI IN THE PRESS

(VIEW Press KIT)

 

"DIVI... ...innovative new device combines the practical functionality of a pill dispenser with the communication power of the modern smartphone." 

"...Medical professionals can opt to incorporate DIVI technology into their practices and to receive alerts/data reports regarding patient adherence to dosage regimens..."

Research


DIVI's most progressive feature is its robust analysis of adherence activity. This data is made available to researchers for the purpose of adherence study. According to the world health organization: "increasing the effectiveness of adherence interventions may have a far greater impact on the health of the population than any other specific medical treatment". 

INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT MEDICATION ADHERENCE 

  • "1 in 2 Americans suffer from a chronic illness." - *
    (diabetes, heart disease and cancer...) 
  • "treatment of chronic conditions accounts for 75% of total medical spending." - *
  • "50% of chronic patients do not adhere to their medication plans." - **
  • "In 2002, the cost of improper medication adherence resulted in $100 billion of medical waste. Today that problem is now $290 Billion" - **
  • "Patients that adhere to their medication schedules are 26% more likely to have a positive treatment outcome."- ***
  • “increasing the effectiveness of adherence interventions may have a far greater impact on the health of the population than any improvement in specific medical treatments.” - World Health Organiztion - *
* Sabaté E, editor. , ed. Adherence to Long-Term Therapies: Evidence for Action. Geneva, Switzerland: World Health Organization; 2003. 

** Chronic Care in America: A 21st Century Challenge, a study of the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation & Partnership for Solutions: Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD for the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation (September 2004 Update). “Chronic Conditions: Making the Case for Ongoing Care”. 

*** Lee JK, Grace KA, Taylor AJ. Effect of a pharmacy care program on medication adherence and persistence, blood pressure, and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol: a randomized controlled trial. JAMA. 2006;296(21):2563-2571. 


The Power of "THE CROWD"

DIVI was conceptualized over two years ago. It has come a long way, but now we need your help. Your support will allow us to initiate tooling and manufacturing of our ALPHA device. Help bring this technology to you and the millions of people who need it most.


PRE-ORDER DIVI



Any more questions? Ask away! 

faq@divipill.com or COMMENTS

story:
Hi I am Bryan and I am doing this campaign to help with my future father in law Chuck's Medical expenses and to help us move to San Antonio From Sedro Woolley WA. We have sold everything that we had of value and found out that its still not enough. When we get there we will be taking care of chuck and Bonnie trying to help with physical and medical needs. The majority of the money will be used for his medical  bills and what Medicare  does not cover and, that's quite a bit . We are making calls on this end  to get things taken care of but trying to do this from 6 states away is no easy task. This is why we are asking for help. We have exhausted our resources. They have no one else to help them and because of there medical expenses they can not afford food. If you know anything about pancreatic cancer it hurts a lot you do not get relief.  Chuck has gone from 185 to 122 lbs  in span 3 months. we know  that Chuck will die  we are trying to make it so that he dies with dignity and because of his wife's disabilities she can not help with much.  what ever you can spare financially spare  would be appreciated if you can not help your prayers and help getting the word out would be much appreciated thank you. Sincerely Bryan& Tami 

 

 

 

 

 

Pancreatic cancer is a malignant neoplasm originating from transformed cells arising in tissues forming the pancreas. The most common type of pancreatic cancer, accounting for 95% of these tumors, is adenocarcinoma (tumors exhibiting glandular architecture on light microscopy) arising within the exocrine component of the pancreas. A minority arise from islet cells, and are classified as neuroendocrine tumors. The signs and symptoms that eventually lead to the diagnosis depend on the location, the size, and the tissue type of the tumor, and may include abdominal pain, lower back pain, and jaundice (if the tumor compresses the bile duct).

Pancreatic cancer is the fourth most common cause of cancer-related deaths in the United States[1] and the eighth worldwide.[2] Pancreatic cancer has an extremely poor prognosis: for all stages combined, the 1- and 5-year relative survival rates are 25% and 6%, respectively;[3] for local disease the 5-year survival is approximately 15% [3][4] while the median survival for locally advanced and for metastatic disease, which collectively represent over 80% of individuals,[4] is about 10 and 6 months respectively.[5] Individuals vary, however - some are only diagnosed when they are already terminally ill and therefore only have a few days or weeks. Others have slower progression and may live a couple of years even if surgery is not possible.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
