story:
In August 2012, my husband and I found out we were expecting a new addition to our family. Immediately we knew that we wanted a different experience than we had during the birth of our first son 2 years ago which took place in a hospital. After persuing midwives and learning more about home birth we knew making the choice to home birth was right for our family. We know this choice is not for all families, but are excited to experience it in a few short months. We are here seeking help from friends and family to purchase supplies for the birth as well as finish paying birthing costs to our wonderful midwife. Please help us achieve our dream of a natural, safe birth in our home. Thank you so much for your generosity. 

 

Things we still need for our home birth:

Birthing Pool

Birthing Kit (supplies for labor and delivery)

Payment to Midwife

 

**The birthing pool we are purchasing will be able to be used up to 3 more times after our birth so this is the perfect opportunity for us to "pay it forward" and help other families in our position persue a home birth.**
story_txt:
In August 2012, my husband and I found out we were expecting a new addition to our family. Immediately we knew that we wanted a different experience than we had during the birth of our first son 2 years ago which took place in a hospital. After persuing midwives and learning more about home birth we knew making the choice to home birth was right for our family. We know this choice is not for all families, but are excited to experience it in a few short months. We are here seeking help from friends and family to purchase supplies for the birth as well as finish paying birthing costs to our wonderful midwife. Please help us achieve our dream of a natural, safe birth in our home. Thank you so much for your generosity. 


 
Things we still need for our home birth:
Birthing Pool
Birthing Kit (supplies for labor and delivery)
Payment to Midwife
 
**The birthing pool we are purchasing will be able to be used up to 3 more times after our birth so this is the perfect opportunity for us to "pay it forward" and help other families in our position persue a home birth.**

story:
CLICK HERE TO GO TO THE NEW CAMPAIGN!

We created The Gripster so you have more ways to train!

After seeing the various ways that rock climbers train to get stronger we decided that there was room for development, so we created The Gripster.

The Gripster has been in development now for over two years. We have created many different versions and done a lot research and testing. Many knowledgeable and experienced climbers have provided feedback about our shapes and we have adjusted them accordingly. Now that we have some great shapes locked down we are ready to share them with all the climbers out there who are psyched to find new ways to train.

  • The Gripster was designed by Mike White who currently resides in Berkeley CA.
  • The Gripster started out as a passion project, but after much encouragement from various climbers who loved it, we decided to share it with the climbing community at large.
  • The contributions from this campaign will go towards our first production scale order, without this capital we would never be able to share The Gripster at a reasonable price.

We are really excited to be here on IndieGoGo and any contribution you can provide to get this project off the ground will be deeply appreciated.

We Need capital for our first order, you get The Gripster

The fabrication of equipment like this is extremely time consuming and labour intensive:

  • We need to create many silicon molds to be able to deliver a quality product in sufficient time and quantities.
  • Each mold is made from a master shape that has been CNC Routed and hand finished.
  • If we don't reach our desired goal we will still be able to fulfil the orders we do get.

A Project of Passion

Mike White started developing The Gripster over two years ago. He has spent a lot of his free time on this project and poured a large amount of his own personal savings into its development. If we can get The Gripster off the ground with this IndieGoGo project it will make all his hard work worthwhile, and he will also be really really happy!

  • The Grispster is a great training tool and there are endless possibilities and variations of how it can be used for training.
  • The Gripster is suitable to training at home, in the gym or while traveling.
  • A home spun maker project, The Gripster was developed at TechShop SF using CNC Routers, Laser cutters and many of the wood shop tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you're not able to contribute at the moment, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • If you know any climbers then share our project with them on Facebook or Twitter, Its easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Gripster, The Chunkster and The Globester come in five colors. Please note, due to variations in different batches of resin, temperature and humidity levels its not always possible to get an exact color match on each product. Keep in mind that each of our products are hand made. We will always do everything we can to get the colors right but please be aware that due to these variables some batches may come out with variations in tone.

Check out the T-Shirts currently availible on thegripster.com

Got Grip T-Shirt

No Beta Symbol
T-Shirt

Get a Grip T-Shirt

Thanks for checking out our campaign and thank you for your contributions!

story:
free yoga classes to help people manage and relieve pain

I am raising money for studio rent to provide free yoga classes to help people manage and relieve pain three times / week

  • Arthritis, scoliosis
  • Back stiffness / pain
  • Make yoga accessible to low income earners.

Why yoga? Yoga helps people manage and relieve stress and pain, tones muscles, and gives strength. If a person is able to have relief from pain, then they are more likely to be patient, courteous, compassionate, more confident, and mindfully of there action have a better living experience to Do-Feel-Be acts of kindness.

World Karma Project mission is to make YOU and the people around you “awesome,” our goal is to promote “Do better, Feel better, Be better.” With aim of creating and promoting generosity and kindness.

 

 Adam Quang E-RYT 500: The founder of World Karma Project, an energetic and easy-going fellow, known for his wisdom and compassion. A registered yoga instructor with Yoga Alliance E-RYT 500 master level. Adam work as a yoga therapist, specializing in building back muscles and improving flexibility. Adam clients have scoliosis, severe arthritis and back stiffness. He combines everyday common sense and uses ashanga flow as a base, with Thai yoga massage for his teaching style. (more…)

"People think that I am delusional and crazy for believing that we can live in a world where there are full of laughter and people are kind. I simply believe in HUMANITY" Adam Quang

Please donate what you can and help spread the word by sending this link to 10 of your friends or more. http://igg.me/p/221548?a=1178539

Have a wonderful day.

What We Need & What You Get

Project budget: $79 800.00
Rent $75 000 yr [$6250 month / 1500sq foot ]
Utility & Insurance $4800yr [$400 month]

If we dont reach 70% of the project budget, donation will help me  do printing and marketing for my  Do Better Project, free yoga in the park, and studio rental fee for yoga workshops (Arthritis, scoliosis. Back stiffness / pain, yoga for low income earners.)

story:
Debra Lindsay-Williams has been a pillar of strength for the children and families in the Zion / Beach Pk.  Illinois area.  She started Little Champions for Christ to make a difference in the lives of her own two granddaughters.  Having left a lucrative career in sales, Debra fell into the stark realities that single parents face day-to-day .... how to take care of their children while working, and how to make sure they're in a safe environment.
Debra has felt the pinch of the economy's problems over the past two years and has been struggling to make ends meet...and sometimes they didn't even come close.  Most middle-class people know that pain...whether it's from a reduction in hours, an out-right loss of their job, or downsizing to a position that pays far less than their skills and talents warrant. 
In light of her struggles, and basing her strength on the Lord's shoulders (not her own) she has persevered.  But times have become difficult and she refuses to let Little Champions for Christ  fall thru the cracks.
I'm here to ask for any one's assistance that has a heart for children, and a desire to keep them safe, secure and on the straight and narrow path. 
If you could spare even $5.00, together we could all help her and the kids she loves and cares for be able to continue without the looming issues of not having enough money. Debra's Little Champions for Christ is a phenomenal day care and after-school care environment.  There's no one I've met in my 64 years of living who has the patience and dedication to children more than (or even close to) that of Debra!!
The Lord has placed this desire to help children in her heart...if you want to be God's Hands and Feet please make a donation...no matter how small you think it might be, there is strength in numbers.
Jeremiah 29:11 says "For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you a hope and a future".  Kids today need hope and they need to know they can have a future ... Debra is helping keep that seed fertile in the lives of these children.  Won't you help too?
 
 
Catherine (Cathie) Bucci-Bryden
Bookkeeper
 
 Psalm 115:14-15
14,  May the Lord give you increase,
     you and your children!
15,  May you be blessed by the Lord,
      who made heaven and earth!

story:
Our Time in a Tanzanian Orphanage

My name is Katie Wauchope and I lived in an orphanage in Arusha, Tanzania from September 2011 to February 2012. For three of those months, I was joined by Kayla Price and we are now launching this campaign together.

The idea behind our fundraising came about whilst we were conducting surveys for the orphanage files. The orphanage supports 250 children in a small town called Ngara Mtoni just north of Arusha. These children attend classes at a centre run by the orphanage and receive occassional clothing donations and basic support. However, it was evident that they were living in extreme poverty. Among the questions asked by the survey, we asked if the children slept under a mosquito net. The overwhelming answer was no, despite the acknowledgment that suspected malaria cases were common and sadly, had resulted in child fatalities.

We want to provide all of these children with a mosquito net. Please, we need your help to make our idea a reality.

The Specifics

We need $3700 in total to acheive our goal. I live in Scotland so some of the fundraising has taken place over here but we are still a long way from the target!

The nets are being provided and shipped (airfreight) by a Scottish company who provide bulk orders of mosquito nets to large corporations. The family who run the business have close ties with Tanzania themselves, and gave us a generous discount.

We will be sending 165 double size nets (perfect for the whole family!) at $12 each and 35 single nets at $9 (these are approximate prices converted from GBP). Add all that up with the cost of sending by air and delivery to the orphanage (more expensive than by boat, but much more reliable) and you get $3700!

Some facts about Malaria

It is preventable yet a child still dies from malaria every single minute. We know, you've heard that one before. But really think about it.

It affects almost half of the world's population, 90% of the fatalities in Africa.

Malaria carrying mosquitos bite predominantly at night, making nets an effective preventative.

In Tanzania, an estimated 60 000 people die as a result of malaria every year, 80% of these being children under the age of five.

The children we are sending nets to rarely receive medical aid because they do not have enough money. This is the case for thousands of families yet malaria still acounts for nearly half of all hospital outpatient visits.

How YOU can Help

Please consider donating, any amount is appreciated!

Want to do more? Please share this page with friends, family and colleagues! Post it on facebook, twitter, send it by email - any way you can!

Thank you for reading our campaign.

story:
This money will be used to offset the hours I missed during the majority of the month of July as a result of my surgery.


Edit: If anyone in particular was wondering where the money will be going, I will be using it to buy down some debts I've accrued but it will mostly be used so I can start paying rent again and buy some long term food. If you'd like a further breakdown, feel free to ask me.

story:
Short Summary

NVC Foundation and Balsam Hill are partnering this Christmas in July to raise awareness and make an impact in the lives of infants, toddlers and young children in the Philippines.  Every child deserves an equal chance for a healthy life.  All donations up to $1,000 will be matched 100% by Balsam Hill, and and Balsam Hill will also match 10% on donations exceeding $1,000

What We Need & What You Get

NVC Foundation's nutrition program provides undernourished infants and young children in the Philippines with a daily Mingo Meal for six months, giving them added nutrients for optimal growth. Mingo is a nutritious, instant food powder that turns into a rich porridge when mixed with water.  NVC targets undernourished infants, toddlers and young children during the vulnerable period of early growth. 

  • Support a six-month feeding program for one child: $45
  • Donate one Mingo meal: $0.12

For every $50 dollars donated, you will receive a mystery ornament from Balsam Hill's Mistletoe and Holly Christmas Ornament Set.  

The Impact

Laboratory studies show that Mingo provides the ingredients necessary for the development of psychomotor and cognitive functions, and boosting immunity against infectious diseases. Another side benefit? Mingo is manufactured in an NVC-managed production plant in the Philippines. NVC uses equipment provided by the Philippine Department of Science and Technology and other donors. Whenever you donate or order Mingo, you’re also providing its manufacturers with a source of livelihood aside from helping to feed children.


Other Ways You Can Help

For more ways to support The NVC Foundation - Click Here

manufactured in an NVC-managed production plant in the Philippines. NVC uses equipment provided by the Philippine Department of Science and Technology and other
donors. Whenever you donate or order Mingo, you’re also providing its
manufacturers with a source of livelihood aside from helping to feed children.




    Other Ways You Can Help For more ways to support The NVC Foundation - Click Here

story:
Hier findet ihr eine deutsche Beschreibung des Projektes.

Aqui se encuentra una versión del proyecto escrito en Español.  

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who am I?

For the ones who don't know me yet – I am a Ivonne Pannier. I previously worked in the IT sector for IBM and then decided to change my career. Since 6 years I am working as a naturopath especially applying Traditional Chinese Medicine. I am also a yoga teacher with focus on Hatha and Hormonal Yoga (see my web page „about me“).




During the TCM Congress in Rothenburg in 2015 I had the chance to receive an introductory course about the use of sound, especially for applying tuning forks to acupuncture points. The effect it had on my body was really impressive.

Since then I have been using the tuning forks nearly every day in my practice. All the people that had the chance of feeling them, don't want to miss it. 



What is the goal of this project? 

Why do I need your help via Crowd Funding?

I would like to deepen the use of sound in my therapy and therefore aim at attending a well-grounded training. I really hope that you will support me in this project – either because you live nearby and would like to gain a voucher for a treatment by supporting me. Or you just like me, or the idea of integrating sound healing to become a greater extend of therapy and would like to exchange experiences with me.

The sound therapy training of choice is the one held by Michele Averard and Nestor Kornblum (http://globalsoundhealing.net/en) and will take place from the 17th of October until the 1st of November 2015 in the Dome in Alcalali (Spain). The two have built this retreat center to give sound a special surrounding and make sound vibrations even more effective on us. Since decades, Michele and Nestor both work with sound-healing – as a team and one by one.

What is it that attracts me especially about their training?

1. The some itself that gives sound a unique and special ambience.

2. The spectrum that both are able to teach to discover sound in its various facets and therefore getting a better feeling on the vast options of using sound.


  

 

Here you can find a YouTube video of Michele and Nestor, so you can get a clue about the teachers of the training: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E3mN35Qn8jY

I would be really happy about your support.


A short excursion into the world of Sound 


While listening to music everybody surely noticed at least once that our body is attuning itself to the music it is listening to. Some music stimulates us, makes us maybe even restless or aggressive. Other music is calming us, even helps us meditating or eases the way into deep sleep.

Why does Sound have such an immense effect on us? 

Our body consists out of 55-75% of water (dependent on age and gender). Water is a really special element with peculiar characteristics. Vibrations are spreading much faster in the water than in the air. Sounds are nothing else then special audible vibrations. Through the fast spreading ability of water, sound has the power to reach down to the smallest cells in our body. Thus vibrations have the opportunity and potential to help the body reach a balanced state.




Sound Therapy - How does it work?

The Sound Therapy (for instance the Acutonics System) works with „universal sounds“ that means those sounds that derive themselves from the movements of the planets and stars in the universe. This is one of the philosophies of humankind that act on the assumption that the big is mirrored in the small. Thus the sounds of the universe represent as well our own balanced vibration setting. Therefore working with them helps us to connect ourselves again with the BIG, the universe, working with special tuning forks, chimes, singing bowls etc.

If that sounds a bit too spiritual for you please wait a second and read the next passage looking at the scientific view on the power of vibrations.

There are important and well-known names that planted the basics for the use of cosmic sounds, for example:

  • Pythagoras, who discovered arithmetical relations between the tones – harmonic intervals

  • Kepler, who discovered the relations between the movements of the planets – the harmony of the universe

  • Cousto who translated those planetary movements into musical notes - http://www.planetware.de/tune_in/cousto/biographie.html



Besides the work of those 3 well-known persons sounds and vibrations were in the past and are even more today researched scientifically. This field is now known as „Cymatics“ formed by the swiss natural scientist Hans Jenny. He refined works of e.g. Galileo Galilei and Ernst Florens Friedrich Chladni. Chladni is known for his Chladni Sound Figures that were created by putting powder on a plate and then bowing it with a fiddlestick. In consequence the powder was moving through the vibration into patterns – from easy ones up to really complex ones that we find everywhere in nature.

Chladni Figures: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernst_Chladni#Chladni_figures

Cymatics:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cymatics



Hans Lauterwasser (a name that speaks in his favour - „pure water“) also did research in the sector of Cymatics. His incredible work can be explored here:

Web page Lauterwasser: http://www.wasserklangbilder.de/

Youtube:

  • Lauterwasser – English/German(15min): The Sound of Sacred Geometry: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9R4Bkwh9h9c

  • Lauterwasser – Water Sound Images of a Gong (3,36min, ohne Ton): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vjISePjQJi0


What else can I say here than: Nada Brahma - „All is Sound“


How much money is needed?

I need 1925€ to be able to do the training. This money contains also the fees that are needed to support the portal Indiegogo. I would be fantastic if we could reach that goal together.


What do you get when you support me?


When we talk about Crowd Funding you clearly also want to know what you get when you support me.

Those who live nearby (Oberboihingen/Germany, Altea/Spain, Monneren/France) get a voucher for a treatment and so can sense directly the potential of sound. Thus they can directly benefit from the training I will do and its outcome.




And what is in for the others not living close? Maybe you are just a good friend and like to support me on this path or you plan a trip and can include a wonderful sound treatment as part of your vacation that will surely increase relaxation. :-)




What happens in case we reach more than 1925€? 


That is another important question.

In case we really reach more than 1925€, which would be amazing, I would invest the money in new equipment for my practice, e.g. more tuning forks adapted to the new knowledge and needs, singingbowls, etc…



Thanks a lot for your attention and help!

story:
Chizi Igwe and Uchechi Kalu; we had heard of each other long before we even met. For black women, Beijing can be small like that sometimes. Almost immediately after we met though, we realized we both had a passion for black hair care, and more importantly we both wanted to bring quality black hair care service to Beijing. Currently one salon in Beijing caters to our kind of hair. In one of our first conversations, we lamented on how poor their quality of service was, how high their prices were, and how somebody needed to offer our vibrant black expat community an alternative.

After careful consideration we decided it should be us. But we want to start small. This Spring we want to sponsor a black American stylist to spend one month in Beijing taking clients. We plan to cover all major expenses – flight, visa, and accommodation.

Our project is called Mane Synergy. We’re inspired by the growing and vibrant Black community in China as well as the entrepreneurial spirit that's alive in Beijing. We’re so committed to providing quality service that we’re partnering with a premier French salon in Beijing. During his or her one-month stay our stylist will set up shop in Catherine de France Hair Salon. And Catherine, the shop owner, has pledged to reach out to her network of friends –ranging from ambassadors to business women alike – to help us make this project a success.

This is where you come in. The cost of sponsoring a stylist and advertising our project in a few major expat publications is USD $8,500. We know this kind of project has never been done before in Beijing, but we refuse to believe it too ambitious for us to start. We appreciate any contributions you’re willing to make so that this project might become a reality.

If you have any questions you can contact us at manesynergy@gmail.com.

Thank you for your consideration,

Chizi Igwe and Uchechi Kalu, Founders of Mane Synergy

story:
Baby Milk Gaza Neonates 3 Appeal 

About EMGAZA 

EMGAZA Team was found in the last Israeli genocide over Gaza strip July 2014, its aim to provide medical aid to hospitals, clinics, and individuals in need. We are a group of Pharmacists, Logisticians and Journalists working voluntary with full of passion and love to Palestine. 

In a cooperation with EMGAZA Team - Gaza Strip and Muslims in- Need - UK, we establish the "Baby Milk Gaza Neonates Appeal 3" that provides milk to babies who their mothers can't breastfeed due to various problems such as hormonal disturbance, stress, and premature delivery. 

EMGAZA team has done two appeals that provided baby milk special formula to neonates who had malnutrition, anaemia and lactose intolerance in addition to other appeals that targeted different sectors such as disabilities, patients with cancer, and LED lights.

Watch EMGAZA "MILK" Appeals at this link 


EMGAZA Strategy Work 

Our strategy works based on incorporation with Local NGOs in Gaza strip. This corporation facilitates us getting info about people in need since these NGOs have registered names and free access to their humanitarian issue.

EMGAZA Philosophy 

We do believe and support BDS movement ( Boycott Divestment Sanction) that calls to boycott Israeli goods and related stuff. All items that we are dealing and providing through our appeals are within this frame. 

Goal and calculation

The number of targeted babies (0-6 months/age) are 250, each one will get 2 cans of the baby milk. 

The cost of each cartoon box of the baby milk is ~ 168 GBP which contains 24 cans. 

Target price for 250 babies x 2 cans = 500 cans 

500 cans/ 24 =  ~ 21 cartoon box 

21 cartoon box x 168 GBP = 3528 GBP is the total target price. 

Follow-up 

Since we hit the target, We will update you as always with written reports, Photos, and video films. 

Perks 

Improve your contribution by picking up one of the motivating perks left the screen. 

Info may help you when you contribute in USD, EUR or other currencies 
All currencies are accepted. In the contribution field, simply enter the GBP amount equivalent to the amount in your currency that you wish to donate. 
www.xe.com offers a currency converter tool for efficient calculation of daily exchange rates.


EMGAZA Team Manager 

EMGAZA supporters, We are so proud of you and your efforts as well. You've been great standing with Gaza and its people. 

We call you again to smash "Baby Milk Gaza Neonates Appeal III" target to be able to get the needed milk for almost 250 registered baby cases.  

If you can't afford, we understand, then share the link with your beloved ones to increase the chance of hitting the target. 

We believe in humanity, we believe in you.

Dr.Hani Siliman Salamah

Some picture of our previous milk appeals 

For more check these links out 

http://tinyurl.com/z9ken4b

http://tinyurl.com/z5xcyr4

http://tinyurl.com/jkk98k3

story:
Practice anytime, anywhere - and make the world your own yoga studio!


The BANALE YOGA MAT is a natural rubber, full-size yoga mat that shrinks to the size of a 64oz water bottle, in a few seconds.

 

 

High-quality, sustainable materials to support your practice wherever life takes you!

With sustainability in mind, we designed a high-performance mat that will exceed the expectations of the most expert and demanding yogi, while remaining light and extremely portable. The natural rubber that composes the mat is an amazing, sustainable material that guarantees superior grip, thanks to its stickiness and the advanced anti-slip finish, and is super easy to clean with the dedicated essential oil Banale Spray.

If you want, you can easily remove the pocket from the Mat while practising, thanks to the integrated velcro strap.

 

 

Forget the hassle of bulky yoga mats.
 Moving around with your own mat has never been so easy!


Outdoor, in the city or travelling. Wherever you are going, the Banale Mat will easily come with you! The professional look of the closed mat is perfect for the transition from the office to the yoga studio!

 

Move with ease and focus on your practice thanks to the water-resistant, concealed external pocket.


 

With the Banale Yoga Mat you will not need a second bag anymore: just put your keys, wallet and smartphone - or any other small items you love - into the concealed pocket and you're ready to go.

 

The Banale Mat journey began with a simple equation: more yoga = better life, and to do more yoga we need our yoga mats to be more portable

With this simple idea we began to sketch a few designs that would accomplish our goal and draw upon our very core ideals; make life on the move as easy as possible. In order to help you stay active and continue practising yoga even on the go, we needed to craft a portable yoga mat. However, to craft a mat that caters to real individuals, we reached out to yoga professionals to develop our mat with us, searching for the perfect material, the perfect size, and the perfect grip. And we have done just that
 

 

After four months of testing multiple prototypes with different types of rubber, different sizes, and different designs, our yoga professionals unanimously decided on the current rubber for its cushioning and gripping properties, perfect size for portability and usability, and design for the sleekest look and functionality.

We feel blessed to have met such inspiring individuals down the road, and we want you to meet them as well!

The amazing people who tested, and fell in love with our Mat all over the world!

 

In today’s society, we are constantly on the road. Each day is a journey away from home. We travel to work, we travel on planes, we go to workout in a gym, and we go out to meet our friends. And yet, ironically, we still spend our lives trying to perfect our home, the place we only come back to sleep.

Banale was born in 2014 with a mission: to create products that leave the inconveniences of travel behind, making your life on the move the best it can be.


The friendly and informal atmosphere that we have built at the Banale headquarters, located in Milan, Italy, allowed us to launch and bring to the market 12 innovative products, and design many more, while still having fun.

We are very proud to say that all our products are designed in Italy.

We are an experienced team with product development, and after 3 successful crowdfunding campaign, we know exactly how much time and effort this process takes.

 

24Bottles is the Italian design brand with the mission of unburdening the planet from disposable plastic bottles, providing a wide range of carefully designed, high-quality, easy-to-carry, sustainable stainless steel bottles for daily hydration on the go.

Yoga Essential has created a versatile clothing collection with a sober, simple and timeless design. High quality apparels all made in Italy with superior natural fabrics. Sober and elegant versatility inspires every garment in their collection.

 

 

If you are ordering the yoga clothing, make sure to check this size chart!

 

 

How do I clean my Banale Mat? And how do I care for it? The Banale Mat can be cleaned by wiping down the mat with the Banale Spray. We recommend to not put the Banale Mat in the washing machine, or use any soap for cleaning. The rubber won’t absorb any dirt or germs. To extend the life of your mat, do not leave tit mat exposed to direct sunlight. If wet, allow the mat to dry before rolling up.
What is Banale Yoga Mat? It’s a portable Yoga Mat designed to practice Yoga anywhere!
Who created the Banale Yoga Mat? Filippo Biagi is our product designer. He worked closely with a team of yoga professionals to craft a Mat that fits the need of every yogi or yoga enthusiast with an active lifestyle.
How much does it weigh? The Banale Yoga Mat weighs approximately 1.2Kg.
How can I open it? It’s easy, just open the buckles and rollout the Mat.
Do you ship worldwide? Yes, we do ship worldwide.
Isn’t the mat too thin? The mat is purposely designed to be light and portable. The 2mm thickness of the mat guarantees enough support and grip to confidently tackle any challenge, thanks to the qualities of the natural rubber. Here’s what Cristina, a yoga teacher and one of our beta testers, said about thickness and overall support of the mat: "I practice a very dynamic yoga and where good grip and support are key, and the natural rubber works just perfectly"
Why do I have to wait longer than usual? This is not just pre-orders: You're helping to build the device, and we need to know how many to make before we can start production. This is the first of its kind, and you'll be glad you waited. We will send you updates while we work to produce the first batch.
If I have other questions, who should I contact? support@banale.com

And yet, ironically, we still spend our lives trying to perfect our home, the place we only come back to sleep.Banale was born in 2014 with a mission: to create products that leave the inconveniences of travel behind, making your life on the move the best it can be.The friendly and informal atmosphere that we have built at the Banale headquarters, located in Milan, Italy, allowed us to launch and bring to the market 12 innovative products, and design many more, while still having fun.We are very proud to say that all our products are designed in Italy.We are an experienced team with product development, and after 3 successful crowdfunding campaign, we know exactly how much time and effort this process takes. 24Bottles is the Italian design brand with the mission of unburdening the planet from disposable plastic bottles, providing a wide range of carefully designed, high-quality, easy-to-carry, sustainable stainless steel bottles for daily hydration on the go.Yoga Essential has created a versatile clothing collection with a sober, simple and timeless design. High quality apparels all made in Italy with superior natural fabrics. Sober and elegant versatility inspires every garment in their collection.   If you are ordering the yoga clothing, make sure to check this size chart!   How do I clean my Banale Mat? And how do I care for it?  The Banale Mat can be cleaned by wiping down the mat with the Banale Spray. We recommend to not put the Banale Mat in the washing machine, or use any soap for cleaning. The rubber won’t absorb any dirt or germs. To extend the life of your mat, do not leave tit mat exposed to direct sunlight. If wet, allow the mat to dry before rolling up. What is Banale Yoga Mat?  It’s a portable Yoga Mat designed to practice Yoga anywhere! Who created the Banale Yoga Mat? Filippo Biagi is our product designer. He worked closely with a team of yoga professionals to craft a Mat that fits the need of every yogi or yoga enthusiast with an active lifestyle. How much does it weigh? The Banale Yoga Mat weighs approximately 1.2Kg. How can I open it? It’s easy, just open the buckles and rollout the Mat. Do you ship worldwide? Yes, we do ship worldwide. Isn’t the mat too thin? The mat is purposely designed to be light and portable. The 2mm thickness of the mat guarantees enough support and grip to confidently tackle any challenge, thanks to the qualities of the natural rubber. Here’s what Cristina, a yoga teacher and one of our beta testers, said about thickness and overall support of the mat: "I practice a very dynamic yoga and where good grip and support are key, and the natural rubber works just perfectly" Why do I have to wait longer than usual? This is not just pre-orders: You're helping to build the device, and we need to know how many to make before we can start production. This is the first of its kind, and you'll be glad you waited. We will send you updates while we work to produce the first batch. If I have other questions, who should I contact? support@banale.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Laura, Ive been a big girl as long as i can remember and tried every diet out there, some with short lived success. Im 21 years old and have made the very serious decision to have laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy surgery. I have joined private health the last 12 months to decrease costs.

However i Live in North QLD where the price of surgery is very high due to the limited surgeons available. There for I have sourced a surgeon in Brisbane who with flights and accommodation is 1/2 the price of getting it done more locally.

I don't want this to be a sob story, poor fat girl can't she just exercise and do it the right way. The fact is i have a neuropathic pain condition that covers my neck, right should and back causing constant pain and headaches and miagrains 24hrs a day 7 days a week. Im also a large breasted woman and this adds enormus extra pain to my condition, making working out incredibly hard.

I have booked into have my surgery January 14th 2015, I have most of the costs saved for surgery however my hours at worked have been severely cut and i can't even afford my basic expenditure even living back at home. 

Having this Surgery is life changing, Im going a dietitian and have had counselling. This is NOT an easy way out for me.... its the FIRST step to a health life. I plan on getting a gym membership after i have lost enough weight for exercise to be less painful. And i plan on this being the beginning of an amazing life.

I am approximately $3,000 short of where i need to be by January, to pay for the surgeon, anaesthetist, travel, accommodation, health insurance excess.

Im asking YOU for help as i do not want to burden asking my mother for this money as she almost passed away two years ago from complications due to obesity. And this would be added financial burden. Her complication has made me put my life in perspective and i need to do something drastic now!

any extra fund raised will be used to get a gym membership and and more dietician help and support.

Please help me be the best me possible !!!

story:
The GIVE mHealth app connects doctors with patients in remote areas directly through live voice and video with integrated care.

GIVE mHealth was produced in collaboration with individual doctors from the hospitals mentioned in the video and not by the hospitals. It was independent doctor to doctor collaboration from all regions of the US assembled by Dr. Thymes at Harvard School of Public Health.

Features

• Mobile Medical Records System: Built-in Digital Medical Records with distance treatment. 

 • Searching Diagnostics: Searches diagnostics with advised-treatment for immediate results. User may also take direct control with manual modes. 

 • Unlimited Medical Reach: Combine multiple items on one app for expansive personal health. 

 • Detailed Long Distance Medical Care: Perfect for enhancing emergency care, long distance (rural or remote) reach. Allows patient to seek treatment anytime by connecting user with on-call nurses, available 24 hours each day with live voice and video stream! 

 • Education Tools: Improve your health with education by searching with health education tools! 

 • Easy 5 Step-Medical Care: Quickly get the treatment you need in real-time. 

 • For use with iPads, Google tablets, and Surface for Remote Healthcare: The most detailed available interactive mobile remote healthcare on Earth. 

 • Reaching Doctors: Advanced extras for remarkable remote healthcare. 

Receive Medical attention, immediately! 


Remote diagnostics is an excellent hybrid of our hospitals in our homes, addressing patients needs immediately. The app was designed to move fast which makes it a very effective way of addressing health care needs. The device also addresses convenience, as it allows you to seek medical attention from the palm of your hand. Unlike the hundreds of apps you use on your phone, this remote medical app can be used to save help your life or someone who needs medical care who can not reach a doctor, but is by your side. 

Our objective is clear, we want to improve healthcare accessibility by launching the ultimate remote medical app and have a product that may help save lives. Our app is unique and distinguishable from others on the market because it combines technology with healthcare, enhancing the users life with remote mobile health, medical connectivity and live voice and video. This app will be easily accessible for everyone, from experienced remote health professional users to first time GIVE mHealth owners. Most importantly, we have created an app with features designed to provide endless opportunities to improve healthcare reach with mobile technology! 


Say hello to the GIVE mHealth App!

On top of its fountain of features, GIVE mHealth is available in a range of awesome styles and is the perfect size to take wherever you go! It’s the most mobile way to search critical diagnostics which you can share anywhere. Enjoy the beauty of mobile diagnostics and get inspired with this breakthrough app! 

We are thrilled to be working with Indiegogo in this project and can’t wait to start to GIVE mHealth. We need your support on this mission to make this remote healthcare app dream come to life and make quality healthcare attainable in any part of the country. 

The retail launch price of GIVE mHealth (without the additional attachable Medical Records) is currently planned as being between $120 and $150, so with the Early Bird Deal rewards, you save at least 40% on your App! We plan to have the app manufactured and ready for download in December 2014 (please note this is an estimate only; we unfortunately cannot guarantee this download date). Please back us today to help make our remote dream a reality and make huge, exclusive Indiegogo savings! 


Multiple Searching Modes: to Cover Every Kind Of Remote Healthcare Need GIVE mHealth has a Search for Treatment searching mode so you can easily review critical symptoms and find the closest medical treatment in the touch of a button. You can also switch to open up all kinds of medical health options. 

 • Treatment On Search Mode – With this mode you can easily get remote healthcare assistance. Configurations on the app detect the details, and the app gives back the closest amount of information on the symptoms. 

 • Treatment On Manual Mode - This mode is great for searching for hospitals and clinics. With Get Treatment on and you can switch between reaching a 24-hour nurse and reaching the closest physical hospital location. 


Taking Control of Our Health: We have created the GIVE mHealth App for doctor’s to be closer to you and you to be in control. 

An Advanced Medical Records System: Search unique remote diagnostics and have expansive detail with GIVE mHealth Medical Records System! The App has a built-in Advanced Digital Medical Records. Additionally, the Expansive Medical Digital Records are included in the offer. 

Expansive Digital Medical Records:  This app has Digital Medical Records that saves securely with cloud security systems and allows you to search timely up-close-and-personal medical information focusing on past health issues, previous medication, and previous diagnostics. It’s perfectly suited to spontaneous remote healthcare assistance! 


Medical Records Attachment: This turns into a detailed medical records assessment with doctor’s analysis that can be seen when mobile. 

Digital Medical Records Attachment: This equivalent medical records attachment shows the medical records with a summary. It's great for on-site immediate care and diagnostics in cases such as in-route critical care (i.e. ambulances). 

Receive Long Distance Care: The medical records setting on your app is perfect for remote and rural areas to connect to doctors and nurses for diagnosis, education, and treatment. With GIVE mHealth, there is also setting so doctors can provide diagnostics as well as keep up with the patients. Give it a go for remote or rural healthcare in real-time! 


Search Unlimited Medical Items: GIVE mHealth is the first modern remote app which allows you to search directly to doctors and nurses interactively with live voice and video stream. This means you can combine numerous items on one app for immediate healthcare! 


Health Education Tools: Take full control of your healthcare through your phone with the selection of mobile health education tools that come with the GIVE mHealth app. By connecting to health advice over your phone, you can have timely and detailed assessment, and get health care education. 


The Live-Stream Remote Medical Format: The app works with the high quality and not widely available remote healthcare, established for its detailed technology and clear medical assessment. Your real-time reach of medical care and diagnostics will be at your fingers from anywhere to the doctor and nurse’s reach through live voice and video stream. 


The Best Mobile Setting in the Remote Diagnostics World: With its VOIR (Virtual Operating Interactive Response) the GIVE mHealth App has the most assured setting currently in the remote health services world. With live voice and video stream, doctors can view the patients through video, respond to the video with diagnostics, issue potential treatment, and send the patient to 24-hour real-time nurse care. 

GIVE mHealth App Specifications


Indiegogo -Exclusive Rewards! 

With your generous support, we will be able to launch this amazing new remote mHealth app and to show our heartfelt thanks, we are offering you some exclusives as well as critically low Indiegogo supporter prices before GIVE mHealth App is released for regular retail purchase! Please check below for the full listing of the rewards on offer! 

Every dollar counts! The minimum donation is $1 and is highly appreciated. Whatever you can GIVE! 

Pledge $5 or more: Thank you! You are providing some real help in completion the GIVE mHealth app and the launch of the Pilot Program. You will receive a signed card from a GIVE mHealth participating doctor! 

Pledge $10 or more: Thank you very much! You will get a GIVE mHealth key chain.  

Pledge $20 or more: We are very grateful, thank you! We will send you a GIVE mHealth note book and keychain.  

Pledge $35 or more: You will receive a 15% discount on the GIVE mHealth download as well as a GIVE mHealth note book and keychain.

Pledge $65 or more: With this special Early Bird deal, get the GIVE mHealth App -a very low price! Free download. 

Pledge $85 or more: With this special Early Bird deal, you get the GIVE mHealth App with its built-in Digital Medical Records and included for a very low price! Free download. 

Pledge $125 or more: Get the Special Indiegogo Edition GIVE mHealth with its built-in Digital Medical Records plus, the 24-hour Nurse and the Virtual Reach included. Free download and 1-year free connection. 

Pledge $170 or more: Get the 24-hour Nurse plus Virtual Reach and Direct Doctor Edition GIVE mHealth App with its built-in Advanced Digital Medical Records included and a Droid tablet and Treatment Education! Free download and 1-year free connection. 

Pledge $250 or more: Get the 24-hour Nurse and Direct Doctor Edition GIVE mHealth App with its built-in Advanced Digital Medical Records and a Droid tablet and Treatment Education, along with hospital and doctor identification capability! Free download and 2-year free connection. 

Contributing doctors: 24-hour Nurse with Virtual Reach and Direct Doctor with (Doctor to Doctor network reach) GIVE mHealth App with its built-in Wide Digital Medical Records and a Droid tablet, along with hospital and doctor identification capability and the results of the Harvard GIVE mHealth Pilot Program Research along with addition to the Advisory Board. Free download, free connections, and free updates. 

Help these Doctor’s Start Remote Healthcare


We are so thrilled by the support we received from the medical community that we have decided to fund GIVE mHealth (http://www.givemhealth.us/) via Indiegogo. As was the case with these ambitious challenges, we designed the remote mHealth app from scratch and are now entering the hospital-doctor-to-patient pilot stage. This will require brand new medical integration techniques at a substantial financial cost. We need the initial Indiegogo support to ensure the demand for this investment so that we can set the ball rolling and get this into hospitals and doctors! 

So where are we with the development of GIVE mHealth so far? Well, we have just tested out our prototype and are further optimizing the app based on this. The next immediate step is the fully remote app and hospital launch! By backing this Indiegogo campaign, you’ll help us perfect the hospital pilot program and fund the App's full-scale production. As a loyal backer, we promise to keep you updated on the development process every step of the way. 

We produced the prototype in December 2013 and plan to have the fully remote app ready for hospitals in November 2014 (please note this is an estimate only; we unfortunately cannot guarantee this download date). To keep you up to speed with our project so far and over the coming months, here is GIVE mHealth App Timeline (numbers in diagram stand for weeks). 


iPad Medical Pilot will be followed by cross-platform for Droid and Windows Platform 


Who built the GIVE mHealth app? 

GIVE mHealth project was produced by an Information Technology Harvard Fellow, and former Research Associate at Harvard Business School to the author of “Redefining Healthcare”, and assembled a dedicated group of doctors for the development team and a tech team from different parts of the US and India for the design. The entire project has been spearheaded by GIVE, Inc. (Generating Innovation Ventures & Enterprises). The doctors who analyzed and assessed the production of the GIVE mHealth app come from American College of Emergency Physicians, Central Neighborhood Health Foundation, Cedar-Sinai Medical Center, OBGYN of East Brunswick, New York Department of Health, Active Rx Clinic, and Harvard Medical School. 

We have a globally active group of doctors dedicated to remote and mobile diagnostics and healthcare facilitation. We have a great, community of doctors and mobile health enthusiasts from all over the world who inspired us to build the GIVE mHealth app. Our team of doctors and tech professionals has been pushing the boundaries of remote healthcare and mobile technology and the GIVE mHealth app is the solution in our step towards mobile diagnostics. Our tech team has over 20 years of experience in designing, developing and testing applications along with experience in building web, telecom and mobile products and services. 

Since we began experimenting with remote healthcare, we haven’t been able to stop! With this vast experience in remote healthcare, we are now ready create a new, dedicated remote product with GIVE mHealth! This incredibly detailed mobile remote app is a pure product of inventive ideas and our never-ending passion for mobile healthcare! GIVE mHealth will be our first Indiegogo project to date: The results of the pilot will be researched at Harvard University and then distributed to hospitals and medical institutions along with the final product. We are now thrilled to be launching GIVE mHealth through Indiegogo! 

You can find out more information about our history and the GIVE mHealth app at RMbawuike@fas.harvard.edu, GIVE mHealth, C.Reginald Mbawuike, Hutchings Center, Harvard University, 108 Mount Auburn Street, Suite 3, Cambridge, MA 02138.


Availability Information: GIVE mHealth will be initially available for use in the US only. If you have a specific question about shipping, handling or tax please just write us a message! 

Risks and challenges: Learn about accountability on Indiegogo We are really excited about launching this new innovative remote mHealth app. The most important aspect of the project is that we fulfill our promise to you, our supporter! 

Project by: Generating Innovation Ventures & Enterprises (GIVE) Inc. 

For more information on GIVE mHealth contact: Reginald C. Mbawuike IT Research Fellow | Mobile Health Technology Hutchins Center | Faculty of Arts & Science Harvard University RMbawuike@fas.harvard.edu Ph: 617-980-0272 | Fax 617-276-3517 

Risks and challenges

As with all new products, there is an element of risk involved in the project as there may always be unforeseen production and distribution issues. The most critical step for us is the mechanical design and distance network connectivity. Stabilizing the healthcare networking system and live-stream diagnostics output control is a particularly delicate challenge for us. We are also taking particular care in implementing the integration and ensuring that all features can be re-launched on a mass scale.

We assure you that we are all working very hard to launch a critical product that arrives well on time but is, above all, of optimum quality! At the moment, we have finalized the medical scheduling, technical aspects, and mobile designs and have tested out the prototype. The next stage is to execute the pilot on with hospitals to scale the remote capabilities. We estimate that the first downloads of GIVE mHealth App will be by the end of November 2014. And we promise that the first quantities of the remote mobile health app will be downloaded to our loyal Indiegogo backers! For the rewards on offer, we will endeavor to distribute rewards as soon as we can.

However, certain rewards may take longer to organize than others due to logistical reasons. We promise to keep you informed on this every step of the way.

Although we have set the bar high to create a remote mobile health app that is so advanced, we are an enthusiastic team with over 20 years of experience in producing mobile apps and over 50 years in remote medicine. We are absolutely ready for this exciting challenge!

We have a globally active group of doctors dedicated to remote
and mobile diagnostics and healthcare facilitation. We have a great, community
of doctors and mobile health enthusiasts from all over the world who inspired
us to build the GIVE mHealth app. Our team of doctors and tech professionals
has been pushing the boundaries of remote healthcare and mobile technology and
the GIVE mHealth app is the solution in our step towards mobile diagnostics.
Our tech team has over 20 years of experience in designing, developing and
testing applications along with experience in building web, telecom and mobile
products and services. 
Since we began experimenting with remote healthcare, we haven’t
been able to stop! With this vast experience in remote healthcare, we are now
ready create a new, dedicated remote product with GIVE mHealth! This incredibly
detailed mobile remote app is a pure product of inventive ideas and our
never-ending passion for mobile healthcare! GIVE mHealth will be our first Indiegogo
project to date: The results of the pilot will be researched at Harvard
University and then distributed to hospitals and medical institutions along
with the final product. We are now thrilled to be launching GIVE mHealth
through Indiegogo! 
You can find out more information
about our history and the GIVE mHealth app at RMbawuike@fas.harvard.edu, GIVE
mHealth, C.Reginald Mbawuike, Hutchings Center, Harvard University, 108 Mount Auburn Street, Suite 3, Cambridge, MA 02138.
Availability Information: GIVE mHealth
will be initially available for use in the US only. If you have a specific
question about shipping, handling or tax please just write us a message! 
Risks and challenges: Learn about
accountability on Indiegogo We are really excited about launching this new
innovative remote mHealth app. The most important aspect of the project is that
we fulfill our promise to you, our supporter! 
Project by: Generating
Innovation Ventures & Enterprises (GIVE) Inc. 
For more information on GIVE mHealth contact: Reginald C.
Mbawuike IT Research Fellow | Mobile Health Technology Hutchins Center |
Faculty of Arts & Science Harvard University RMbawuike@fas.harvard.edu Ph:
617-980-0272 | Fax 617-276-3517 
Risks and challenges
As with all new products, there is an element of risk involved
in the project as there may always be unforeseen production and distribution
issues. The most critical step for us is the mechanical design and distance
network connectivity. Stabilizing the healthcare networking system and
live-stream diagnostics output control is a particularly delicate challenge for
us. We are also taking particular care in implementing the integration and
ensuring that all features can be re-launched on a mass scale.
We assure you that we are all working very hard to launch a
critical product that arrives well on time but is, above all, of optimum
quality! At the moment, we have finalized the medical scheduling, technical
aspects, and mobile designs and have tested out the prototype. The next stage
is to execute the pilot on with hospitals to scale the remote capabilities. We
estimate that the first downloads of GIVE mHealth App will be by the end of November
2014. And we promise that the first quantities of the remote mobile health app
will be downloaded to our loyal Indiegogo backers! For the rewards on offer, we
will endeavor to distribute rewards as soon as we can.
However, certain rewards may take longer to organize than others
due to logistical reasons. We promise to keep you informed on this every step
of the way.
Although we have set the bar high to create a remote mobile
health app that is so advanced, we are an enthusiastic team with over 20 years
of experience in producing mobile apps and over 50 years in remote medicine. We
are absolutely ready for this exciting challenge!

story:
Symmetry's Campaign 100% Funded!

WE DID IT! Thank you so much to everyone who supported Symmetry and believed in our mission! Check out this article on what this means to us. 
Obesity drug developer hits $30K crowdfunding goal


Symmetry Scores $30K Crowdfunding Goal to Support Anti-Obesity Compound


For media or investor inquiries please visit our website and click the contact page:
http://www.symmetrytherapeutics.com/



  • All proceeds support our groundbreaking research on a new treatment for obesity, a disease that affects 35% of adults and 16% of children in the United States. We all know someone who has struggled with obesity or have personally struggled with it ourselves, and we need new options fast.
  • To say thank you, we're providing thank you gifts (Perks) centered around healthy living. Pick your favorite Healthy Living Perks and enjoy them knowing you made a difference.

Symmetry's work is getting noticed

Biotech company’s research could help people affected by obesity - September 15th, 2015
Growing biotech company encourages community involvment - September 2nd, 2015
Partnering for Health - August 21, 2015
Biotech Company’s Research Could Help People Affected By Obesity August 17th, 2015

Obesity drug Preclinical trials show promise - August 15th, 2015

Saratoga Springs startup Symmetry Therapeutics tries crowdfunding to raise money for drug research - Front page August 15h, 2015
http://www.biotech.ng/biotech-companys-research-could-help-people-affected-by-obesity/ - August 14, 2015
Symmetry Therapeutics Personalized Medicine Offers New Approach to Combat Obesity August 13th, 2015
Look at Health with Dr. Paul Arciero on LookTV - August 12, 2015
Crowdfunding for pharma research? Local biotech firm gives it a try - August 12, 2015
Biotech company's research could help people affected by obesity - August 11, 2015.

Summary

At Symmetry Therapeutics, we are a team of scientists developing new class of anti-obesity compounds. And we are trying to change the pharma industry's secretive status quo in the process. 

Proceeds from this campaign support our groundbreaking research on a new class of anti-obesity compounds. 0% will be used to pay ourselves salaries -- that way we can maximize the impact of your support. Will you support our obesity research by contributing $5, $25, $50 or $100? 

To say thanks for your support, we are providing Perks focused on healthy lifestyle changes to help people maintain or lose weight and keep it off. 




Research

At Symmetry Therapeutics, we are a team of scientists researching a new class of therapeutics to treat obesity. Our lead compound, SYM401, has shown promising  results. It decreases fat mass by 50% in obese mice after just one month of treatment. This change was also associated with improved type 2 diabetes in our studies.


So far, our work has led to 3 issued US patents and a significant research grant from the National Institutes of Health. We are currently working to conduct the pre-clinical studies necessary to obtain IND status with the FDA and move toward clinical trials. We want you to be part of that process.



Our Story & Team

Symmetry Therapeutics was born out of years of research. Our technology was developed at Skidmore College, a liberal arts college located in Saratoga Springs, NY, when Jon Brestoff Parker was working in the laboratory of Dr. Thomas Reynolds an expert in metabolic diseases. Jon then went on to earn his Masters in Public Health on the George J. Mitchell Scholarship and then enrolled in the MD/PhD Physician-Scientist program at the University of Pennsylvania’s Perelman School of Medicine. When Jon finished his PhD, he met Milad Alucozai, another Mitchell Scholar hailing from Purdue University who had a strong background in business and science. 

As a team, Jon, Thomas, and Milad realized that they had all the tools and know-how to develop a new anti-obesity treatment and formed Symmetry Therapeutics, put their own money on the line, and surrounded themselves with world-renowned experts in academia, business, regulatory affairs, and intellectual property to advance their lead therapeutics candidate to clinical trials and the market. With the team and foundation in place, they set out to become different from traditional pharma, as the world’s first community-powered pharma company supported by you. 


Changing the status quo in pharma

As we push forward with our research, we want to change the secretive ways of the pharma industry. One way hope to do that is by engaging with our community (including you!) in each step of the process. That’s why we created the Symmetry CrowdSource Community (SC2). Through this group, you will get the following benefits:

5 Key Benefits of SC2

  • Inside Scoop:  Be the first to hear about our progress, directly from the CEO
  • Problem Solve:  Invitations to help us solve problems together as a community
  • Network:  Meet other Symmetry supporters online and grow your network
  • Micro Jobs:  Paid contract-for-hire jobs on a need basis
  • Weight loss support:  Access to a private online forum to engage with each other and our team about making healthy lifestyle changes. This will be a safe space for open dialog to encourage and support weight loss. 


Use of Funds

To show you how serious we are about transparency, here is where your money will go: Proceeds from this campaign go directly to the research needed to get our anti-obesity compound into the clinic and into the Federal Drug Administration (FDA) regulatory process. Our funding goal allows us to complete additional studies and compete for additional National Institutes of Health (NIH) funding aimed at getting our compound into clinical trials. If we exceed our goal, we can save time and move much faster to get this medication to the people who need it. All funds raised in this campaign will be used for the following:

  • Perk fulfillment
  • IndieGoGo fees and transaction fees
  • Operational costs such as lab safety compliance and personnel training
  • Research support
  • See the graphic below for additional details

0% of funds from this campaign will be used to pay ourselves salaries so we can maximize the impact of your support


Call to Action

We need your help to go from pre-clinical to clinical and together we can all change the status quo. Will you support us by contributing $5, $25, $50 or $100 to our campaign? Please also share what we are doing with your friends, family members, or colleagues who care about our work and the opportunities on this campaign page. Take the step towards a better future with us.


Perks

Through our partnerships, we  have assembled a collection of Perks at significant discounts. These Perks are all focused on nutrition and exercise to bring you one step closer to a healthier life. After the campaign, all of these Perks will still be available but at regular retail prices. 

Every Perk listed is at least 20% off regular retail price, but we have been able to bundle items together at greater discounts, up to 60% off. The best discounts are our Featured Perk (the Total Health Pack) and the Complete Actahealth System. These were designed to bring you a full complement of lifestyle products that we have vetted personally.

All Perks will be assembled after the campaign ends and shipped or emailed to you.

By Investing in our research and development for the future, we want to empower our community members to start living healthy today. That’s why we partnered with Actahealth, Dr. Paul, MOTEAVA, "Lo-cal" Local, and Restaurant.com® to provide Perks that we hope will empower you to make healthy lifestyle changes. 

Actahealth:  A new type of fitness-tracking system that syncs between a wearable activity band (Actaband) and body fat scale (Actabody) that are much more affordable than competitors’ prices. The complete Actahealth system allows you to stay in touch with your body and set goals that you can track easily.  

Dr. Paul:   We are bringing you a couple distinct Perks from Dr. Paul, an emerging health and wellness media personality. We are excited that every Perk comes with a free 1 month trial (3 months where indicated) to Dr. Paul'sPRISE Protocol App, a Perk that is based on 25 years of research that have helped some people lose over 50 lbs. The PRISE Protocol App is a pro-active daily guide to help you make the right nutrition and exercise choices. For a limited number of contributors, Dr. Paul is also offering One-on-One coaching!

MOTEAVA:  Organic green tea matcha that's enriched in antioxidants and other natural products that have been shown in research studies to promote weight loss and increase alertness. Matcha is made from green tea plants by using a millstone to pulverize the entire plant into such a fine powder it all but dissolves in water. This process prevents destruction of the beneficial antioxidants and natural products, allowing matcha to have 137X more EGCG and 2.5X more caffeine than a cup of brewed green tea. MOTEAVA is Grade A Ceremonial matcha, meaning it has clean, crisp taste that's superior to culinary-grade matcha. MOTEAVA (100 grams, approx.  50 servings) comes with a recipe e-booklet so you can use it in lots of ways: hot matcha, iced matcha, smoothies, frappes, protein shakes, energy shots and more.

"Lo-cal" Local with Restaurant.com:  Eating out doesn’t have to bad for you, so we are giving you "Lo-cal" Local's 10 Tips to make low calorie choices when eating out + a $50 Restaurant.com® gift card to help you practice your "Lo-cal" Local Tips.



Video Credits:

Produced, Directed and Edited by Neil Ferron and Jianming Li (Eyerisimiaging Production Company)
Cinematography by Weston Karnes and Jianming Li  (Eyerisimiaging Production Company) and Alex Kenyon (Galileo Media Arts) and John Wager (Galileo Media Arts)
Original scores “Uplifting Ending”, “Alexander”, and “UEI” by BC Campbell
Copyright 2015, Symmetry Therapeutics, Inc.; copyright for scores retained by BC Campbell

Please follow us and share our campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Many years of hard work given to achieve the goal. 

My name is Olesya Prystayko. Over ten years I am in triathlon. This year I became Ironman. To qualify for Triathlon World Championship I will race 5 Ironmans in this season. Each of those consists of 2,4 miles swim, 112 miles bike, and 26,2 miles run. 
Only the 35 best women triathletes all over the world are allowed to participate in World Championship in Kalua-Kona, Hawaii. Every day I spend many hours for trainings to be closer to my dream.
One of the reason why I didn't qualify this year is my old road bike. I am able to compete with the best athletes in the world, if I get the best time-trial bike, which all they have. 
The best aerodinamic bike with full the best equipment costs 11940 $. 

What We Need & What You Get

  •  I need the time-trial bike 
  •  you will see me on the Ironman World Championship 
  •  your name or company could be on my racing suit or on my new bike while I compete and cross the Ironman finish line 

Other Ways You Can Help me

  • If you come to my website or facebook page, and follow my trainings, races, I will feel your support.
  • The most important for me is your presence on my competitions. 
  • Tell your friends that they can help me too.

story:
Short SummaryI plan on replacing my stolen bike with a new one.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Dear Friends and neighbors, 


By now, most of you have heard about the tragic accident that happened on the Timberlea Village parkway on January 23rd. Some of you may also know that this accident took the life of a son [Owen Sperry, age 5] of a fellow Timberlea resident (Who also happens to be a cousin of mine).

So many of you have written offering support and this is how you can help:

Please if you wish, go to any Scotiabank Branch to make a donation to the Owen Sperry Trust fund. The name of the account is Owen Sperry Trust #21063-002-00707-18

This is the online collection for this cause and all funds after site fees will be sent to the Owen Sperry Trust. 

The purpose for the funds will be to cover funeral and burial expenses and any additional funds will be allocated to future trust funds in Owen’s honor, a memorial, scholarships or something that will keep his memory alive. Please share this information where you see it appropriate.

Thank you for your support.

My family thanks you all for your concerns and condolences as well as any help you may be willing to give towards this trust fund.
If you have any questions please email myself at adam.allen1@gmail.com or Rebecca Mitton at rebecca.mitton@gmail.com.

Thank you, Adam Allen

*** Janaury 31st update ***

We have reached the goal of $5000 today and we cannot express how thankful we are for all of the beautiful support that we have received.  The family is completely overwhelmed and want you to know this support is helping them at this time.  Although we have reached this online goal, we still urge you to donate if you wish.  There is still so much the family would like to do in Owen's memory.

story:
My friend Mike has Malignant Myoepithelioma.  It is a rare form of cancer which can't be treated in his hometown of Buffalo.  Mike and his wife will have to travel to Boston for his treatment. His insurance will help with that, but doesn't cover airfare, lost wages, food, and all of the other things that he will need.  Please read what Mike said below, then help if you can.  No amount is too small.

I set this goal low at $1000, so that we would be sure to meet it, and pay lower fees, but their expenses are much higher than $1000! Please keep donating and spreading the word!

Thanks!

A small bio

By Mike Tyson 

Please bear with me because I'm not that great at talking about myself. My name is Mike Tyson, no relation to the boxer or the chicken, and I have cancer.

 

This all started out with a chronic pain that no one seemed able to explain for the last three years until finally an MRI in mid-December showed a baseball-sized tumor attached to my spine and one of my ribs. The part on my spine was putting pressure on my spinal cord and the neurosurgeon was rather amazed that I wasn't showing signs of paralysis or other loss of function. I had emergency spinal surgery and I'm now partially spineless, as I like to joke about, due to the removal of pieces of my T-3, T-4, and T-5 vertebrae. I also came away with a reduced tumor.

 

The biopsy came back as Malignant Myoepithelioma which is an incredibly rare form of cancer that is hard to find any real facts on Google. To make matters even more rare, my treatment consists of Proton Radiation Therapy which is offered in only nine places in the United States, Buffalo is not one of those places.

 

Before all of this hapenned, I was a full-time graduate student working to become a teacher. I was working in the Department of Media Studies’ Equipment room at my school and at an after school program because I love working with kids and I needed that help to make ends meet. My wife GiGi is also a student and she is on permanent disability and the lion's share of our income has come from financial aid and student loans while we've been going through school. Now I am unable to work or go to school and our income has been drastically cut. To add to this, the medical bills are already piling up and, even though I have insurance, I will need help with a place to stay in the closest place that does Proton Therapy, Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston.

 

As much as I hate to ask for help from others, I know that GiGi and I cannot weather this storm by ourselves. So many people have already stepped up to offer direct assisstance or even help in fundraising and these people are angels in my estimation. Any little bit of help will get us that much closer to making it through this whirlwind and will be immensely appreciated.

 

Thank you for reading this and thank you in advance for your generosity.

 

Much love,

Mike
story_txt:
My friend Mike has Malignant Myoepithelioma.  It is a rare form of cancer which can't be treated in his hometown of Buffalo.  Mike and his wife will have to travel to Boston for his treatment. His insurance will help with that, but doesn't cover airfare, lost wages, food, and all of the other things that he will need.  Please read what Mike said below, then help if you can.  No amount is too small.
I set this goal low at $1000, so that we would be sure to meet it, and pay lower fees, but their expenses are much higher than $1000! Please keep donating and spreading the word!
Thanks!
