story:
http://igg.me/at/barefootgranniesII/x/639146

THANK YOU!



Today, more than 20 million people die each year due to inequalities in global health. More tan 150 million people face unaffordable health care costs each year. And more than 100 million people each year are plunged into poverty. It’s no longer enough for any one group or country to take action. What we face is a global crisis that needs a global movement to fix it. BE THE CHANGE.  BE A GRANNY. DONATE TO A GRANNY today. Every amount counts, please support our Barefoot Movement

We are coming together as one unified voice to send a powerful message that the time to take action has come; a time to end Female Genital Mutilation and promote women’s reproductive health is now.  Join us, support us, donate to us and let's remind the world of the crisis women are facing. 

The Barefoot Grannies works on a completely volunteer basis in order to change their communities. They want to reach out to thousands of women and men every month!

To make this possible, we need your help to raise funds to train them, provide small grants, purchase bicycles so that they reach distant communities and provide technical support and build their capacity to make them more effective.  Your support will improve on their performance and effectiveness. To give you a sense of some of the costs:

$80 - Will be used to but one bicycle for a granny to reach more communities. We need to buy 80 bicycles.

$100 - Will be used to provide scholastic materials and beddings for girls rescued and will help them get education.

$204 -  is the cost of one-time fistula collective surgery. Some extreme cases require surgery twice or thrice. 

$500 - Will be donated to a Group of Barefoot Grannies. A $500 grant covers a 3 months period

$1000 - Is a 6 months grant to one group of Barefoot Grannies

If you are able to contribute in exchange for any of our perks, we are incredibly grateful and the Barefoot Grannies and us will responsibly put those funds to purpose.

We are ICOD Action Network,  a Uganda based nonprofit founded in March 2008. ICOD Action Network’s work extends beyond material support and touches upon the need to empower communities so that they can be able to sustain themselves. We believe that local driven interventions and innovations are the foundation of sustainable community transformation.  Our core values at ICOD Action Network are deeply rooted in sustainability, human rights, justice, inclusiveness and participation, commitment, accountability and transparency. Resources and responsibilities for decision–making are used in ways that are mutually transparent and answerable to all stakeholders.We are working with grassroots women  and building them into exceptional visionaries for change. Barefoot grannies walk everyday throughout their communities educating them about the dangers of Female Genital Mutilation and are working so hard to improve women’s reproductive health. We are making their visions a reality, please donate to the #BarefootGrannies today.

Through technical support,  resource allocation, mentorship, leadership training, and network building, we are working with 219 grannies from 8 Community Based Groups  of women and grannies to address reproductive health issues in their communities. These are the women and grannies on the frontlines of change working to strengthen women’s rights, improve girls education, increase economic opportunity for women, and promote human rights in their communities.

By providing education, outreach and training led by grannies in the rural communities where women live, we are spreading the word: reproductive rights is the right of every woman, no matter where she lives.

We have a history of working with and supporting the evolution of small grassroots organizations and groups organizations as key means of developing sustainable local capacity. Our work has impacted more than 100,000 people since 2008. People like you have supported our work!

We believe that strengthening local capacity will ensure sustainability of  local reproductive health initiatives.

MARY is a local human rights activist and the co-founder of Kamesoi Women's Group, a group of granneis that moves around communities teaching about the dangers of Female Genital Mutilation, importance of girl-child education and linking service providers to women with health complications. Invest in Mary's commitment to promote women's reproductive rights.

Click here to see what Barefoot Grannies Model works. Learn about what we do and how we are able to change the lives of women in rural Uganda. We have achieved amazing results using grassroots activism with people living with HIV/AIDS in Southwestern Uganda, we are glad to be working with the Barefoot Grannies in Northeastern Uganda to transform communities.

Female Genital Mutilation (FGM) is recognized internationally as a violation of the human rights of girls and women. In some cases, girls bleed to death or die from infections. Later in life, FGM can lead to complications in childbirth and increase the risk of the mother and/or baby dying. The practice also violates women's rights to health, security and physical integrity, the right to be free from torture and cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment, and the right to life when the procedure results in death.

It’s our duty to protect and observe women rights, end the social, cultural and political causes of Female Genital Mutilation and promote women’s reproductive rights. BAREFOOT GRANNIES ARE LEADING EFFORTS TO END FGM AND PROMOTE WOMEN REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH, PLEASE JOIN AND SUPPORT THEM TO CHANGE THEIR COMMUNITIES. 

No donation is too small or too large. Every little bit helps!

  • Make a gift to support Barefoot Grannies and women leaders who are the change-makers of tomorrow!
  • Join our Campaign Team and encourage your friends and family to invest in women leaders everywhere.
  • Share your story! Tweet us @chasingthecut and tell us why you are #ChasingTheCut
  • Follow our Indiegogo campaign throughout the month and receive updates and new perks and see the global impact of your gift.
  • If you can’t contribute financially, there are many other ways to join the team. We appreciate any effort or time you can put toward helping us get this story of determination and love out there in the world.
  • Sign our online petition calling for strong action against Female Genital Mutilation in East Africa through this LINK

Please send us feedback on how to improve our work or if you prefer to wire funds directly to Barefoot Grannies,  contact nationaloffice@icodactionnetwork.org

story:
Please help me continue my fight against Lyme Disease...

***

Please watch the following documentary if you want to learn more about Lyme Disease and share it with your friends and family.

LymeLight - The Story Of Professional Freeskier Angeli VanLaanen Living With Lyme Disease


***

$5 and $10 donations will add up and go a long way to help me recieve the treatment I need.

Even if you are unable to make a donation, please share my story with as many people as you can to help raise awareness about Lyme Disease so that our future generations will have access to better care.

You can share this by using the indiegogo share tools!!


BACK TO MY STORY

My name is Alexis. I am 29 years old and live in Winnipeg, Canada. In September 2012 I was bit by a deer tick and started feeling sick. I immediately went to my doctor and asked to be tested for Lyme disease and West Nile. Both tests came back negative and I was sent on my way with no treatment or referrals.

After that, I was in my doctors office weekly with new symptoms and quickly diminishing energy levels. Within the first month and a half of getting the bite I had most of the symptoms of Lyme and was barely able to make it through the day without assistance from my parents and friends. I had to take a break from school and was unable to keep up at work. I was not being taken seriously by medical professionals and was written off time and time again.

In February 2013 I brought my concerns that it might be Lyme forward to my Naturopath in Winnipeg and he immediately sent my blood away to a specialty lab in California. Three weeks later in early March, 2013, I was diagnosed with what I suspected it was all along, Lyme. Although the diagnosis was something that I needed to move forward with treatment, it was not the news I wanted to hear.

Not may people are aware that getting treated for Lyme Disease by an MD in Canada is next to impossible. Unfortunately, this is the reality for many people who are in the same boat as me, fighting for treatment. I decided that my health is much more important than money and that I would pay for treatment as long as I could do so. 

I currently get naturopathic treatment both in Winnipeg, Manitoba and in Calgary, Alberta. Naturopathic doctors are only allowed to prescribe anti-biotics if they are certified in British Columbia. My naturopathic doctor in Calgary is certified in B.C., therefore has the ability to provide me with access to anti-biotic treatment. Dr. Aparna Taylor is a member of the International Lyme and Associated Diseases Sociey (ILADS) and has dedicated much of her practice to treating tick borne illnesses such as Lyme. I am very fortunate to have her as part of my healthcare team and am hopeful that she will be able to help my get better. The only barrier left standing before me is the financial burden of treatment costs. The main goal of this campaign is to be financially able to continue seeing her and receiving treatment. I ran out of anti-biotics this past week and will not be able to get more until I can afford to go to Calgary and be reassessed. 


Since May 2013 I have spent over $10,000 of savings and RRSPs in an attempt to rid my body of the disease but am still not Lyme free. Although I have 100% drug coverage through my work healthcare plan, none of my treatments or medications are covered by my healthcare insurance because my care has to be provided solely by naturopathic doctors. I have begged and pleaded with my family doctor and several other doctors to treat me or refer me to someone who can and the response is always "I'm sorry, there is nothing I can do for you." 

The money that is raised here will be used solely for: 1) Antibiotic treatment (oral and possibly IV), 2) suppliments to support my immune system, 3) doctor's appointment costs and 4) travel costs to and from doctors appointments across Canada and the US.

My naturopathic doctors estimate that I will need up to two more years of treatment and treatment costs can vary between $10,000 and $25,000 per year including travel costs, antibiotics and supplements. Although I set my campaign goal low at $3,000, I will require a lot more to fully take care of myself over the next couple of years. I set my goal low because it was difficult to come forward and ask for financial help.


Please help if you can, every little bit will help.

Thank you for your generosity and support!


Below are links to the following web pages:

1) International Lyme and Associated Diseases Society

2) Canadian Lyme Disease Foundation

3) Under Our Skin Documentary

4) Good Morning America News Story

http://www.ilads.org/lyme/about-lyme.php

http://canlyme.com/just-diagnosed/

http://underourskin.com/news/under-our-skin-saved-my-life

http://youtu.be/PMB0Tp_wE5A

Even if you are unable to make a donation, please share my story with as many people as you can to help raise awareness about Lyme Disease so that our future generations will have access to better care.

You can share this by using the indiegogo share tools!!

Thank you for your generosity and support!Below are links to the following web pages: 1) International Lyme and Associated Diseases Society2) Canadian Lyme Disease Foundation3) Under Our Skin Documentary 4) Good Morning America News Storyhttp://www.ilads.org/lyme/about-lyme.phphttp://canlyme.com/just-diagnosed/http://underourskin.com/news/under-our-skin-saved-my-lifehttp://youtu.be/PMB0Tp_wE5AEven if you are unable to make a donation, please share my story with as many people as you can to help raise awareness about Lyme Disease so that our future generations will have access to better care.You can share this by using the indiegogo share tools!!

story:
The I AM YOUR campaign was created to continue to bring awareness to the issue of prostate cancer, as well as drive the community to take action through investing in new technology that will make diagnosing the disease easier. 


Prostate cancer is a form of cancer that begins in the gland cells of the prostate, which is found only in males (source: American Cancer Society). 1 in 6 men will be affected by it, and some men die because the disease is not detected early and cancerous cells spreads to other tissues/organs.

STATISTICS: 

  • About 33,720 men will die of prostate cancer. (source: American Cancer Society)
  • About 1 man in 36 will die of prostate cancer. (source: American Cancer Society)
  • Prostate cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death in American men, behind only lung cancer. (source: American Cancer Society)
  • African-American men have the highest rate of prostate cancer in the U.S., and are more than twice as likely than white men to die of the disease. (source: National Cancer Institute)

The PSA (Prostate-Specific Antigen) Test is the standard test to screen for prostate
cancer.  A PSA test measures the amount of prostate-specific antigen in a man's blood. PSA is a protein produced in the prostate, a small gland that sits below a man’s bladder. It is mostly found in semen, which also is produced in the prostate (source: The Mayo Clinic).

 

THE PROBLEM: 
There isn’t an effective FDA approved test available for the detection of prostate cancer.  The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force recommends against PSA tests for screening prostate cancer in men of all ages. The task force stated that the test is unreliable, giving a false positive result 80 percent of the time.

Source CBS News 

A SOLUTION:

pH Medical Devices is an early stage medical device company with the focus of developing an early diagnostic urine based test for prostate cancer detection. Our research has shown that there is an antigen present in urine.

A urine based test would provide:

  • Instant results - patients are diagnosed and informed about necessary biopsy/intervention during the same visit
  • High accuracy – our test uses more accurate antigen, rather than PSA, to test for prostate cancer
  • Elimination of pain points - our test would prevent men from having to undergo unnecessary procedures
  • Lower cost - our technology would reduce patient costs 

HOW IS MY MONEY USED?

The funds raised in this campaign go directly to pH Medical Devices' research and development efforts, and specifically to the hiring of a dedicated post-doctoral
fellow and additional research materials. Our goal is to produce a device that would provide men with accurate results as it relates to their prostate health.

WHY IS YOUR HELP NEEDED?

It takes 10 to 15 years and over $5 billion to get pharmaceuticals/medical devices from the research bench to the patient.

Source: big Think


The I AM YOUR campaign is raising $50k with a community driven social media effort to change the face of prostate cancer. It takes a lot of time and resources to move research to the next level of development. We need your help. No dollar amount is to small. Contribute today.  A life depends on it.

ABOUT THE FOUNDER: 

Kornelius Bankston has a B.Sc. in Chemistry from Morehouse College, a MSc. in Biomolecular Chemistry from Emory University, and an MBA from the Georgia Institute of Technology. He began his career in business development for a start -up company out of Emory University with Dr. Dennis Liotta.  He then went on to work as a project manager for the Georgia Department of Economic Development where his responsibilities were recruiting biotech, pharmaceutical and medical device companies to the state.  During his tenure, he brought 350 new jobs and $30 million dollars in new capital investments to Georgia, and developed an extensive network of biotech, medical device, and venture professional contacts. He also learned the landscape of building emerging companies. Most recently, he has served as the program manager for Morehouse School of Medicine’s Office of Translational Technologies- Division of Industry Collaborative Research. There, he was responsible for managing the school’s portfolio of intellectually property, and industry sponsored clinical trials, as well as building partnerships with biotech, pharmaceutical and medical device companies.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Like and share us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/iamyour 

Follow and re-tweet us on Twitter  - @iamyour14 

Follow us on Instagram - @iamyour14

CREDITS:

Photography for the I AM YOUR campaign provided by www.f22studio.com and www.imagesbymichaelfoster.com

PSA is a protein produced in the prostate, a small gland that sits below a man’s bladder. It is mostly found in semen, which also is produced in the prostate (source: The Mayo Clinic). THE PROBLEM: There isn’t an effective FDA approved test available for the detection of prostate cancer.  The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force recommends against PSA tests for screening prostate cancer in men of all ages. The task force stated that the test is unreliable, giving a false positive result 80 percent of the time.Source CBS News A SOLUTION:pH Medical Devices is an early stage medical device company with the focus of developing an early diagnostic urine based test for prostate cancer detection. Our research has shown that there is an antigen present in urine.A urine based test would provide:

Instant results - patients are diagnosed and informed about necessary biopsy/intervention during the same visit


High accuracy – our test uses more accurate antigen, rather than PSA, to test for prostate cancer


Elimination of pain points - our test would prevent men from having to undergo unnecessary procedures

Lower cost - our technology would reduce patient costs 
HOW IS MY MONEY USED?The funds raised in this campaign go directly to pH Medical Devices' research and development efforts, and specifically to the hiring of a dedicated post-doctoralfellow and additional research materials. Our goal is to produce a device that would provide men with accurate results as it relates to their prostate health.WHY IS YOUR HELP NEEDED?It takes 10 to 15 years and over $5 billion to get pharmaceuticals/medical devices from the research bench to the patient.Source: big ThinkThe I AM YOUR campaign is raising $50k with a community driven social media effort to change the face of prostate cancer. It takes a lot of time and resources to move research to the next level of development. We need your help. No dollar amount is to small. Contribute today.  A life depends on it.ABOUT THE FOUNDER: Kornelius Bankston has a B.Sc. in Chemistry from Morehouse College, a MSc. in Biomolecular Chemistry from Emory University, and an MBA from the Georgia Institute of Technology. He began his career in business development for a start -up company out of Emory University with Dr. Dennis Liotta.  He then went on to work as a project manager for the Georgia Department of Economic Development where his responsibilities were recruiting biotech, pharmaceutical and medical device companies to the state.  During his tenure, he brought 350 new jobs and $30 million dollars in new capital investments to Georgia, and developed an extensive network of biotech, medical device, and venture professional contacts. He also learned the landscape of building emerging companies. Most recently, he has served as the program manager for Morehouse School of Medicine’s Office of Translational Technologies- Division of Industry Collaborative Research. There, he was responsible for managing the school’s portfolio of intellectually property, and industry sponsored clinical trials, as well as building partnerships with biotech, pharmaceutical and medical device companies.OTHER WAYS TO HELP:Like and share us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/iamyour Follow and re-tweet us on Twitter  - @iamyour14 Follow us on Instagram - @iamyour14CREDITS:Photography for the I AM YOUR campaign provided by www.f22studio.com and www.imagesbymichaelfoster.com

story:
(April 2017 Update)SCROLL DOWN TO SEE THE NEWLY UPDATED DESIGN!

 

monkii bars 2™ is an incredibly strong yet ultra-light bodyweight trainer that you can use anywhere—designed for people who want awesome workouts without being stuck in a regular gym. When paired with our app it’s more than just a fitness device—it’s your own private gym, personal trainer, and adventure guide built into one.

 

 

The Adventure Kit transforms your monkii bars 2 into a sleek, self-contained home and travel workout system.  By seamlessly converting from an ultra-portable carrying case into a universal door attachment, it becomes the ultimate companion to monkii bars 2.

 

Whether you're a traveler or home-body, adventurer or weekend warrior, runner or mudder, newbie or musclehead—you now have the freedom to work out anywhere. Do all of the exercises you already know, plus hundreds of new ones you don't, and have an epic workout every time. Say goodbye to the boring routine.

 

 

monkiis are the worldwide tribe of people who have discovered that working out when and where they want has finally made exercise fun. When fitness is fun, it becomes easier to do consistently. When you do it consistently, you become happier, healthier, and more fit. What the heck are you waiting for?

 

 

Thanks to the overwhelming support from the Indiegogo community, the following stretch goals are AVAILABLE TO ALL BACKERS.

 

 

 

monkii Ambassadors are everyday people from around the world who are exceptional in their daily pursuits and share our wildness, passion, and purpose for training anywhere. Meet a few of them and learn more about monkii bars 2 in the following video:   

 

monkiis are the community of people who have made monkii bars a success to date and shared their insights to help us make monkii bars 2 awesome. With over 3,000 monkiis and more each day, here are just a few of the wildest. 

 

monkii Crew is a group of adventurers, designers, storytellers, and fitness freaks currently working hard at monkii HQ in Colorado.   

 

Thanks, and be wild,

Dan, David & the monkii team

We know over 250 exercises is alot, but don't worry, we have a full exercise video library to teach you each and every one with proper form. Learn them all at once, or over a few months (or years)—no pressure.
monkii bars 2 work for all fitness levels whether you're just off the couch or Arnold Schwarzenegger—simply adjust the angle at which you work out, to make the exercise easier or more difficult.


 

 

 
 

 

 

 
Ready to workout? Just insert your phone into the Adventure Kit and open up the MONKII App. You can easily access and follow along to complete workout videos. 
Once your monkii bars 2 arrives, you can dive into our step-by-step training programs and follow along training videos featured on the MONKII APP. Follow them closely or use them as building blocks to create your own workout programs.
 


 
WATCH THE BETA APP IN ACTION:
 

 

 
The Tactical Kit is for those who take their fitness very seriously. It includes everything the Adventure Kit does, but it comes in the most durable materials, and in only one color: blackout. You'll also get a hard copy of the insanely challenging Tactical Training 2 Manual featuring workouts, challenges, and missions that will either leave you stronger or speaking in tongues.

story:
You never have to brush your teeth again!

Amabrush is the world's first, fully automatic toothbrush. This patent pending device brushes all your teeth at once, fully automatic, and finishes in just ten seconds. All you have to do is press a single button, wait ten seconds, and you’ll have perfectly clean teeth!

AMABRUSH is not being offered for sale until a commercialized design is finalized and manufactured.

Due to high demand, estimated shipping will be no longer February 2018. More and specific information about ETA will follow in January 2018! Thank you for understanding and for your patience.

Let's face it: brushing your teeth is not exactly the sexiest thing on Earth. You have to squeeze, scrub, gargle, spit, rinse and floss every morning and evening, every day of your life. Many of us hate brushing our teeth so much that we avoid doing so whenever possible—even though we know we shouldn’t... Brushing our teeth at least twice a day maintains good dental health. This is why we invented Amabrush—a device three years in the making with a single goal: to make toothbrushing quicker, automatic, and more efficient so you have more time for the relevant things in your life.

Your request is our command! We will integrate Bluetooth to all of our rewards at no additional cost. With our Amabrush App for iOS & Android, you are able to connect to your Amabrush unit and make use of various possibilities. You can set different vibration modes (gum massage, whitening, burst mode, ...), configure cleaning time, reorder replacement parts and do many things more!

Amabrush is made out of three parts:

  • The Mouthpiece
  • The Handpiece
  • The Toothpaste Capsules

 

Antibacterial Material

The flexible mouthpiece has built-in micro-channels that transport the toothpaste to your teeth. The mouthpiece is made of antibacterial silicone that kills 99.99% of all bacteria and features 3D-arranged bristles on both sides to clean your teeth. It’s soft enough to prevent gum damage but strong enough to clean your teeth precisely. It can be cleansed by normal rinsing, as you would do it with regular toothbrushes.

Brushing Technique

The bristles are directed in a 45° angle against your gingival cuff. This simulates the Bass method, which is recommended by dentists and experts. The bristles are comparable to soft-bristled toothbrushes. This ensures the most comfortable, safest toothbrushing and makes gum-damage impossible. We work closely with dentists and dental universities to address two concerns: clean teeth and no gum damage.

Single Size

We analyzed over 2,000 different jaws from adult females and males. The small difference between both genders is smoothed out by the flexible material of the mouthpiece. The used material has the characteristic to fit every jaw with no abnormal teeth displacements.

Replacement

As with regular manual toothbrushes and electric toothbrush heads, the mouthpiece should be replaced every 3-6 months. Many studies prove that used bristles are not as effective in terms of plaque removal, as new ones. A single mouthpiece will cost €6.

 

 

Electronics

The handpiece contains all of the complex technology. It creates strong vibrations with an amplitude of 9.5G to oscillate the bristles and clean your teeth. A clever algorithm ensures the generation of different vibrations. This results in a coordinated movement of the bristles, which are designed to have different resonant frequencies.

10 Seconds

Amabrush can brush your teeth in just 10 seconds, because all your teeth are cleaned simultaneously. Even in this 10 seconds, every tooth surface is cleaned longer compared with common toothbrushes. If you brush your teeth for the recommended 120 seconds with a regular toothbrush (manual or electric), every surface gets brushed for just 1.25 seconds (given the fact that you have 32 teeth and every teeth has three surfaces). Amabrush brushes all your surfaces for whole 10 seconds. This means: every tooth surface gets brushed 8x longer and the total toothbrushing duration is 12x quicker.

Pump, Battery & Charging

A built-in mechanism foams and delivers the right amount of toothpaste to your teeth, and the integrated battery lasts for 28 sessions of toothbrushing. So if you go on vacation without the charging station, you can brush your teeth for at least two weeks twice a day.

The handpiece also comprises a low-energy wireless charging module (Qi). So yes, you could even use your wireless smartphone charger to charge Amabrush.

Sharing

A magnetic connection on the handpiece gives you the opportunity to use Amabrush with different people. Simply put the mouthpiece near the handpiece, and the strong magnet will automatically do the rest for you. We were told that "it really works like magic," and we think the same.

Notice: if you want to share Amabrush with different people, you just need a single handpiece! Everyone needs their own mouthpiece, but you don't have to get a separate handpiece for every person!

 

 

Replacement & Varieties

The toothpaste capsules are simply placed into the handpiece, automatically providing the perfect amount of toothpaste each time you brush your teeth. A single capsule lasts for more than a month, costs €3 and is available in three different, FDA-approved varieties: Extra Fresh (blue), Whitening (white) and Sensitive (rose - without fluoride). The toothpaste is specially formulated as it needs to be more liquid than regular ones.

You can also use your own toothpaste with Amabrush, by simply refill our refillable toothpaste capsules, or by applying it directly to the mouthpiece.

Manufacturing

The toothpaste is formulated and produced by a major toothpaste manufacturer with a history of over 100 years. This manufacturer fulfills the quality norm DIN EN ISO 13485 and the requirements of IFS Household and Personal Care Products, and was one of the first manufacturers in Europe retrieving the IFS-HPC certificate.

 

Amabrush is not meant to be better than your regular toothbrush. Wait, what? That's true! Regular toothbrushes (manual and electric) are tools. And tools are only as good as the person using it! The key thing is that most of us use them wrong, or even worse, are not using them at all. 

Brushing teeth is a job where you must be highly concentrated. Toothbrushes should be held like pencils, so that pressure is as light as possible. The bristles should be soft, in order to not damage your gums. And you should just wiggle the toothbrush with subtle vibrations, instead of doing long strokes. Electric toothbrushes are handled differently than manual ones. With them, you shouldn't stroke at all. These toothbrushes are designed to be held in place, so that the micro vibrations of the bristles can do their job (they wiggle for you).

Amabrush covers all of the recommended methods. The bristles are aligned in a 45° angle against the gum line, and are soft enough in order to rub instead to scratch (like nylon bristles). And the pressure against your teeth is light. Subtle vibrations move the bristles, which allows them to remove plaque and keep your gums undamaged.

Amabrush is for people like us - who just brush their teeth because they have to, and not because they want to.

Amabrush was designed to make toothbrushing less annoying. Some of us hate toothbrushing so much, that we brush not concentrated enough, not long enough, not good enough, or not at all. And some of us simply can not brush correctly at all, because they are not able to do so. It is still under development, and currently for people with healthy gum and teeth. This is our goal. Right toothbrushing for everyone and automatically!

 

Further questions?

Please feel free to contact us any time via email.

 

Please choose your package on the top right of this page.​

 

How can I add add-ons to my perk?

After 10 days of your order, you will receive a survey, where you can specify your delivery address and are able to add add-ons and additional items to your current order at special discounted prices, and with no additional shipping fees!

We came up with the idea of an automated toothbrush, simply because we are annoyed by brushing our teeth. Standing in front of the mirror for at least two minutes twice a day, was not really satisfying for us.

Marvin Musialek, the founder, came up with the first prototype in 2015. Together with Martin Forstenpointner, a talented mechanical engineer, and Alexander Stummer, a sophisticated biomedical engineer, we brought the project to life. Advised by Dr. Hady Haririan, a professional dentist and member of the Medical University of Dentistry in Vienna and Austrian Society of Parodontology, we developed and tested Amabrush to the form it represents now. We've established an enthusiastic and interdisciplinary team, and we work closely with medical universities, dentists, and a lot of test customers, in order to make Amabrush as perfect as it can be. We are supported and funded by the Austrian government, private institutions and the European Commission.

Our core team:

 

We at Amabrush love high quality products. They are durable, simple and "just work". We are proud to say that Amabrush is designed, developed and produced in Austria, Germany and USA. This ensures high quality, quick development and low delivery costs.

story:
Our Story

My husband and I began dating when we were 16. Now, ten years later, he is still my best friend and hopefully soon to be the father of our children. That is, if one day, we can have them.

 

Three months before we were married my gynecologist found multiple large fibroids in my uterus. Combined, they made my uterus the size of a five-month pregnancy.  I needed surgery to remove them, and soon.   Weeks later I was sitting in the office of a Fertility Specialist talking about my only option for surgery: a myomectomy (the removal of fibroids through an incision in my abdomen).

 

Here we are, five years and three myomectomies later, with nearly 100 fibroids removed.  I have had mulitiple procedures, a pregnancy, a miscarriage, numerous ultrasounds, visits to specialists, and blood transfusions.  I am now left with two blocked fallopian tubes and invitro fertilization (IVF) as our only option to have a baby. 

 

This is our last chance. The fertility specialist said there will be no more myomectomies, because of too much scar tissue and the blood loss from my most recent surgery last July was tremendous. 

 

We need to have IVF as soon as we can because a hysterectomy is the only way to stop the fibroids that will be too large to endure before next year is over.

 

Weâ€™ve been through so many other things in the last five years, that we havenâ€™t been able to save much money for IVF.  Between starting our lives together as a newly married couple, buying our first home, working, and my fertility problems, the expenses have been great. 

  • 3 Myomectomies

  • 2 HSGâ€™s

  • Multiple Prescriptions

  • Specialists visits

  • 3 different 6 week recovery periods

  • Too many ultrasounds to count

All of this has made the process of saving for IVF extremely difficult.

 

We know that IVF is expensive for everyone. But, we donâ€™t have the option to wait until weâ€™re older, especially with a hysterectomy right around the corner.  In order to save the $16,000 that it requires to have IVF treatments, and hold on to the one opportunity we have for having a child naturally, we are now seeking help.

 

I know for some who will read this it may be a lot to swallow.  But take heart that even though  month after month our lives are filled with defeat, we are not giving up!  Through it all we have and will remain hopeful that, someday, we will have the family we want. We know we are meant to be parents, and when that day comes, all of this will be worth it! With the help of an amazing group of doctors, the support of our awesome family and friends, and strength from God, we believe we will  have a baby!  We are choosing not to let the lack of expenses hold us back.  We are inviting all of our Family, Friends, and anyone who feels led to support us to become a part of our "Baby Welborn Journey"!


 

The Impact

Andrew and I have gone back and forth discussing if it was a "good idea" to post this information online and let the world into this personal and difficult journey we've been on. There are pros and cons that always come up. For starters, there is not a guarantee. This procedure might not work. In addition, many people in our lives will be shocked to hear this has been going on for five years. We hope this will not change the way they treat us and that they will feel comfortable talking about this with us. We must prepare ourselves for the questions and comments that will come, many of which we have dodged by facing these difficulties with only a few close friends, coworkers and family members. All that to say, we can NOT do this without you. The deeper we get into this, the harder it is to pretend like life is great. If we say no to dinner invites to save money, we want you to know why we are saving money. If my attitude is awful and I look sleep deprived, I want you to know it's the side effects of my hormones running rampant. However, after much thought and prayer, we know the pros outweigh the cons. Sharing our story with you, could result in two things. With your help, we could become pregnant and have a baby! That thought in itself is so exciting for us. We could have a child! :) And secondly, if there are any couples reading this that are facing the challenges of infertility, we hope this gives them the courage to speak up, to reach out, to fight! Overall, this is a scary thing for us to admit and if there are others dealing with this too, we'd love to hear from you!


What We Need

 

We have set our fundraising goal to $5,000 although our need is much greater. We have included a detailed description of the prices.

Breakdown of Expenses $13,250

  • Egg retrieval

  • Fertilization

  • Assisted Embryo Hatching

  • Laboratory Andrology

  • Embryo Transfer

â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.

  • Fertility Medication around $3,000

â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..

May or may not be covered by insurance   $2,500

  • Cycle Stimulation, Monitoring and Ultrasounds

  • SIS

  • Laboratory Screening

  • Pregnancy Testing

 

 

*If these services are not covered by my insurance I can purchase a monitoring package for $2,500.  I have not included this in my total estimated cost.

 

Total Estimated Cost = $16,250

 


Other Ways You Can Help

Finances are just one part of this journey. There will be good days and bad days, stress free days and days full of anxiety. We ask that you keep us in your prayers, support us, check on us. Share this site with your friends who may feel led to donate or those you know who are struggling with infertility.

 

 

Side Note

 

Right now, we are hopeful and excited and the only thing stopping us is the money. We will continue to save, sell any possible thing we can, put items we don't use on eBay, anything to help this dream come true for us.

 

We will never be able to thank you enough for the gift you are trying to give us. There are no words that could describe what your donations mean to us. We'll share with our little one(s) each one of your names and the journey we all took together to get them here. More than anything, thank you for joining us on this journey! Thank you for being part of our lives. Thank you for believing our dream could become our reality. 

 

Baby Welborn, one day we will hold you in our arms. We just know it. :)
story_txt:
Our Story
My husband and I began dating when we were 16. Now, ten years later, he is still my best friend and hopefully soon to be the father of our children. That is, if one day, we can have them.

 
Three months before we were married my gynecologist found multiple large fibroids in my uterus. Combined, they made my uterus the size of a five-month pregnancy.  I needed surgery to remove them, and soon.   Weeks later I was sitting in the office of a Fertility Specialist talking about my only option for surgery: a myomectomy (the removal of fibroids through an incision in my abdomen).

 
Here we are, five years and three myomectomies later, with nearly 100 fibroids removed.  I have had mulitiple procedures, a pregnancy, a miscarriage, numerous ultrasounds, visits to specialists, and blood transfusions.  I am now left with two blocked fallopian tubes and invitro fertilization (IVF) as our only option to have a baby.  

 
This is our last chance. The fertility specialist said there will be no more myomectomies, because of too much scar tissue and the blood loss from my most recent surgery last July was tremendous.  
 
We need to have IVF as soon as we can because a hysterectomy is the only way to stop the fibroids that will be too large to endure before next year is over.

 
Weâ€™ve been through so many other things in the last five years, that we havenâ€™t been able to save much money for IVF.  Between starting our lives together as a newly married couple, buying our first home, working, and my fertility problems, the expenses have been great. 


3 Myomectomies

2 HSGâ€™s

Multiple Prescriptions

Specialists visits

3 different 6 week recovery periods

Too many ultrasounds to count
All of this has made the process of saving for IVF extremely difficult.




 
We know that IVF is expensive for everyone. But, we donâ€™t have the option to wait until weâ€™re older, especially with a hysterectomy right around the corner.  In order to save the $16,000 that it requires to have IVF treatments, and hold on to the one opportunity we have for having a child naturally, we are now seeking help.

 
I know for some who will read this it may be a lot to swallow.  But take heart that even though  month after month our lives are filled with defeat, we are not giving up!  Through it all we have and will remain hopeful that, someday, we will have the family we want. We know we are meant to be parents, and when that day comes, all of this will be worth it! With the help of an amazing group of doctors, the support of our awesome family and friends, and strength from God, we believe we will  have a baby!  We are choosing not to let the lack of expenses hold us back.  We are inviting all of our Family, Friends, and anyone who feels led to support us to become a part of our "Baby Welborn Journey"!
 
The Impact


Andrew and I have gone back and forth discussing if it was a "good idea" to post this information online and let the world into this personal and difficult journey we've been on. There are pros and cons that always come up. For starters, there is not a guarantee. This procedure might not work. In addition, many people in our lives will be shocked to hear this has been going on for five years. We hope this will not change the way they treat us and that they will feel comfortable talking about this with us. We must prepare ourselves for the questions and comments that will come, many of which we have dodged by facing these difficulties with only a few close friends, coworkers and family members. All that to say, we can NOT do this without you. The deeper we get into this, the harder it is to pretend like life is great. If we say no to dinner invites to save money, we want you to know why we are saving money. If my attitude is awful and I look sleep deprived, I want you to know it's the side effects of my hormones running rampant. However, after much thought and prayer, we know the pros outweigh the cons. Sharing our story with you, could result in two things. With your help, we could become pregnant and have a baby! That thought in itself is so exciting for us. We could have a child! :) And secondly, if there are any couples reading this that are facing the challenges of infertility, we hope this gives them the courage to speak up, to reach out, to fight! Overall, this is a scary thing for us to admit and if there are others dealing with this too, we'd love to hear from you! 



What We Need 
 
We have set our fundraising goal to $5,000 although our need is much greater. We have included a detailed description of the prices.
Breakdown of Expenses $13,250

Egg retrieval
Fertilization
Assisted Embryo Hatching
Laboratory Andrology 
Embryo Transfer 
â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.
Fertility Medication around $3,000â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..
May or may not be covered by insurance   $2,500

Cycle Stimulation, Monitoring and Ultrasounds
SIS
Laboratory Screening
Pregnancy Testing
 
 
*If these services are not covered by my insurance I can purchase a monitoring package for $2,500.  I have not included this in my total estimated cost.
 
Total Estimated Cost = $16,250

Share this site with your friends who may feel led to donate or those you know who are struggling with infertility.
 
 
Side Note
 

Right now, we are hopeful and excited and the only thing stopping us is the money. We will continue to save, sell any possible thing we can, put items we don't use on eBay, anything to help this dream come true for us.
 
We will never be able to thank you enough for the gift you are trying to give us. There are no words that could describe what your donations mean to us. We'll share with our little one(s) each one of your names and the journey we all took together to get them here. More than anything, thank you for joining us on this journey! Thank you for being part of our lives. Thank you for believing our dream could become our reality. 
 
Baby Welborn, one day we will hold you in our arms. We just know it. :)

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Welcome to our quest to Mend Mindy's Migraines! Mindy McCartney is a good friend of mine from high school who is a NICU nurse in Albuqerque, New Mexico. She has struggled with a brain tumor and other neurological problems since her second year of college in 1998. She lives in constant pain due to extreme chronic migraines, but we finally see a light at the end of this tunnel! The light is provided by a doctor specializing in chronic migraines; unfortunately, Mindy lives in Albuquerque, and the doctor is in Denver. This campign is raising money to help Mindy and her husband travel to Denver to get the care she needs to live a full, normal life. 

What We Need & What You Get

$1200 for the initial evaluation in Denver, CO. This includes:

$177 for blood work, $475 for a 2.5 hour complete physical, $175 for a 1.5 hour explanation of findings, $169 for special tailored vitamin/mineral supplements, $165 for two 30 minute sessions with a nutritionist.

Travel/lodging to Denver

Follow up care including medications, treatments ($70) and phone consultations ($150).  A doctor here in Albuquerque will coordinate care with the doctor in Denver, but the initial consultation and some follow up visits must take place in Denver.

ANYONE who donates will get a handwritten thank you note from Mindy.

THE IMPACT

Mindy was diagnosed with a cavernous hemangioma (blood vessel tumor) in 1998. She has been through 15 surgeries, including removal of the hemangioma (1.5 cm of the hemangioma still remains), insertion and calibration of a lumbar-peritoneal shunt and insertion and calibration of a ventral-peritoneal shunt. The changes in cranial pressure cause her to see double occasionally. She has seen too many neurologists and neurosurgeons to count over the last 15 years.  At this point Mindy's neurologist and neurosurgeon have tested everything they can think of and have basically told Mindy she will have to live with the unbearable pain of the headaches for the rest of her life. Someone, hopefully the doctor in Denver, will be able to offer Mindy hope. Telling a young woman she has "to live with this" is just not acceptable. 

Throughout all of this Mindy graduated from Trinity University with a BS in Biology and Psychology in December of 2002. She got her BS in Nursing from the University of Colorado Health Sciences in 2006. She became a registered NICU nurse in February of 2007 (Mindy had worked as a technician in the NICU since 2003).

 Mindy is an amazing NICU nurse. She is the one who monitors the premature newborns day and night to make sure they get the medications and care they need. Most importantly, Mindy spends quality time with the nervous parents to explain what is happening to their precious children and comfort the parents and newborns. She cannot give 100% of herself to the patients and parents because of the excruciating pain in her head. Mending Mindy's migraines will not only affect her life and the life of her husband, family and friends, it will also affect the lives of everyone who must spend time in her NICU.  

Right now Mindy can only work 2 days in a row. She gets 2-3 days off in between 2 day work shifts, and this is not enough time for her mind and body to recover. This has impacted her time with her husband, family and friends.  With no time to relax she can not find any time for herself. She can't ride her bike or go to the gym because overexerting herself leads to a tremendous increase in pain. Bending over also makes the migraines worse, which makes simple tasks such as doing laundry and feeding her 2 dogs and 2 cats a lesson in pain.  We must mend Mindy's migraines so she can regain the carefree spirit I remember from our high school years!


    Other Ways You Can Help


    If you aren't able to donate financially, consider the following to help Mindy:

    1. Share share share her story! Posting on your Facebook page will help get the word out.

    2. Prayer, sending happy thoughts towards the westside of Albuquerque, whatever you feel comfortable doing spiritually.

story:
Have you ever sat at your computer pulling your hair out after reading about your favourite team's latest decision making? We know you have... everybody does. This is what makes sport great. 

We also know that the thought "I could do better" has also crossed your mind.

Here is your chance to have a genuine say in the start up and running of Birmingham's (UK) newest sports team. You get control and you take the glory when you win.

Why Birmingham?

Quite simple. Birmingham is crying out for a sports team that will compete at the top of it's sport. For a city of 1 million, the demand for sport is high, and the chance to get behind and follow the rise of this sports team will get the city excited.

The city has only Aston Villa F.C., Warwickshire Cricket Club and the brand new Birmingham Knights basketball team playing in the top division of their sport. There is a huge gap to fill with a brand new sports team that will bring with it a huge buzz.

What do I get?

The chance to get involved with the decision making of the club ( and other perks). Your vote's will define the club and help make it a success or failure.

You will be getting involved with voting on serious decisions, so important in fact that the first decision you will be voting on is which sport our team will play. 

Further votes will include team names, colours, logos, uniform designs, mascots, ticket prices, wage bills, stadiums plus much much more. 

You will get the chance to control the full start up of the team, plus the first season of operation.

Why your help is so important to us.

Sport isn't cheap if you want to be a success, but with the right sport, organised and run in the correct way, success really can be achieved.

Your help will genuinely be the difference. Starting with the money to provide the means to play, and secondly through your decisions the club will start its journey to the top. 

For as little as £25 your can positively influence a city of 1 million people. You can bring joy to the citizens who are starved of sporting glory.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Tell your pals about this, make some noise. Use the share tools at the top of this page to tell the world about our team.

Lets be champs together!!

story:
Sickle cell disease (SCD) affects millions of people throughout the world. In Niger, 25% of the population or 4 million people are affected by the Sickle Cell Disease. It is a chronic hereditary blood disease, occurring primarily among Africans or persons of African descent. It is characterized primarily by chronic anemia and periodic episodes of pain, enlarged spleen, lethargy, weakness, joint pain, and blood clot formation, etc… Almost all people with sickle cell anemia have painful episodes called crises. These can last from hours to days. Crises can cause pain in the lower back, leg, joints, and chest. Some people have one episode every few years. Others have many episodes each year. The crises can be severe enough to require a hospital stay. People with sickle cell disease need ongoing treatment, even when not having a crisis.

One of the major problems that health centers in Niger are encountering is the lack of sufficient medical supplies and equipment. Often times, the cost of pain relievers and hospital services are very costly on the families, especially the mothers. The majority of the health centers do not have the proper equipment or medical supplies to assist the children. This project will help equip and supply the health centers as well as provide pain relievers free of charge to patients. One of the crucial elements of this project is to provide the hospital with oxygen tanks along other supplies and equipment. 

This project is about financing the shipment of medical equipment and supplies to hospitals and health centers in Niger. As a result of a recent donation request submitted to World Medical Relief, we were granted a donation of two 40 foot containers from World Medical Relief, Inc. The containers consist of medical equipment and supplies worth approximately $900,000.The equipment and supplies will be allocated to the National Center of Reference for Sickle Cell Disease in Niamey, Niger. This project will help the struggling mother with the cost of services and medications.

A budget of $19600 is needed in order to make this project possible. The beneficiaries of this project would be the women and children suffering from this disease. The success of this project would help the families financially as most of the patients are from low income families. 

Your valued donations will not only benefit those less fortunate, but will allow you to participate in this worthy endeavor. Together, we can serve the cause of humanity by saving lives. We are humbled to be a part of an organization that willingly picks up the mantle and strives to help those in need. We would appreciate your support in this effort, and will greatly accept any help you can offer. We have made a commitment to this organization and to this cause, and we cannot continue our tradition of success without the generosity of our family, friends, and well-wishers. Please remember that any amount helps! All donations may be tax deductible. 

You can also make your checks payable to:

Nigerien Association of Michigan

P.O Box 970961

Ypsilanti MI 48197

Please feel free to contact us at namichigan@gmail.com or (734)217-6189 if you have any questions.

story:
I could patter on for hours about Jeff's Gibralteresque solidity, objectively handsome bone structure or formidable lower intestine, but these are a given. What many do not know, however, is that Jeff recently suffered a heart attack caused by the early onset of genetic heart disease.  Despite besting the heart attack with the strength and fortitude of ten thousand steeds, he did not do so without incurring significant medical bills. Nor is he able to avoid the burden, financial and otherwise, imposed by the reality of requiring medication and regularly scheduled treatment for the rest of his life. Given that Jeff's particular skill set lends itself more to "kicking ass" than typical 9 to 5 pursuits, he is without insurance, and the mounting financial obligations are daunting.   
 
For those of us lucky enough to call Jeff son, brother, friend or simply know him, we've benefited from his unmatched capacity for empathy and compassion. Whether taking the time to listen, acknowledging someone's seemingly ignored needs or being an awesome mentor and older brother, his ability to care for and care about others is evident and consistent. Equally evident is Jeff's reluctance to lean upon others, including those of us who regularly depend upon him, regardless of how unnerving or challenging the path before him.  As Jeff's needs are primarily financial, we ask those who feel compelled and are in a position to give, to help with bills incurred and prospective medical expense. I think we can all agree, this guy is friggin worth it.

story:
Hello,      

                                                                                                                                           My name is Ingrid Pfeiffer.  I will be 64 yrs. old on July 29th 2012. The picture you see was taken after I lost all my hair and just before I realized I was in a financial disaster caused by a bad Insurance Company.

I had been working and the Insurance offered at work was high. Since I was very healthy and my income was modest, I decided to go through a less known Company, with a higher deductible and lower monthly premium. Now, six months into chemo, tired and on social security income of 1700/mo, wiped out of all my savings, since I can't work, I find myself in debt for over 100k.

My cancer is responding to the treatments and I am very grateful to God for that, but what will happen to me after I am in remission?

I cannot be approved for Medicare/Medicaid because I have a home and a couple of rentals. And although none of my Real Estate can be sold for any profit, given the Real Estate Market, here in MD, being a multiple property owner I cannot qualify!! for Medicare/Medicaid. I would have to file Bankruptcy and then, if I had less the 2500 dollars in the bank...they may consider me...I have tried everything! There is no way I could make 100K even if I sold everything I worked for, for 48 yrs, since I was 16…

There is something wrong with these rules and I would like someone to take action on it, because I am sure I am not the only person in America in this situation!!

I have Peritoneal Carcinoma. I am trying to raise money to pay for my cancer treatments, AND raise awareness of this rare cancer, Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma, very similar to Ovarian, but spread on the peritoneal lining.

But I also would like someone to realize how silly some of the requirements for Medicare/Medicaid are!!                                                                                        Or if there is someone out there that knows a solution, other than donations, I would love to get their help. I am not proud!!! Each Chemo session is almost 20k!! I get one every 3 wks.

I want people to be aware that this Cancer has no Symptoms, other than being tired. During an emergency surgery due to a strangulated Hernia the surgeon saw spots in my peritoneal lining and if it hadn't been for the hernia, right now I could be dead...So I consider that a miracle! I had just tiredness, and minor pains in the abdomen, which of course I attributed to the hernia.

To top it all because I had a previous hernia, in a different location, the insurance I have, refuses to pay for all the cancer testing and prolonged stay in the hospital because I was taken to the hospital due to a hernia. And they refuse to pay my chemo because one of their clauses written in "fine letters" in the contract, requires hospitalization overnight to pay for chemo. No one stays overnight for chemo!! And they pay a maximum of 1000 for testing!!

Just one PET scan is 4k!!

I know..I know.. I didn't read all the fine writing!!! I know it's my fault for going cheaper, but this is a huge company, a division of a HUGE LIFE INS. CO. based in NY, so I trusted them.. I didn't read the entire 30 page contract...I am at the end of my rope...I worked for 48 years out of 64...and I will lose my excellent credit…and everything I own.

My grown children have families of their own, I have no husband and I don't know where to turn. I am determined to survive, so I can write about this journey!

In the event I do not make it I have arranged for my body to be donated to science, so the money will not be wasted on "ashes"...and someone can potentially get life ...from my remains.

If you have any helpful information or if you have questions, you can write to me at iepfeiffer@gmail.com

Thank you for all that you can do. Any help is appreciated.

Sincerely,

Ingrid Pfeiffer in Maryland
story_txt:
Hello,      
                                                                                                                                           My name is Ingrid Pfeiffer.  I will be 64 yrs. old on July 29th 2012. The picture you see was taken after I lost all my hair and just before I realized I was in a financial disaster caused by a bad Insurance Company.
I had been working and the Insurance offered at work was high. Since I was very healthy and my income was modest, I decided to go through a less known Company, with a higher deductible and lower monthly premium. Now, six months into chemo, tired and on social security income of 1700/mo, wiped out of all my savings, since I can't work, I find myself in debt for over 100k.
My cancer is responding to the treatments and I am very grateful to God for that, but what will happen to me after I am in remission?
I cannot be approved for Medicare/Medicaid because I have a home and a couple of rentals. And although none of my Real Estate can be sold for any profit, given the Real Estate Market, here in MD, being a multiple property owner I cannot qualify!! for Medicare/Medicaid. I would have to file Bankruptcy and then, if I had less the 2500 dollars in the bank...they may consider me...I have tried everything! There is no way I could make 100K even if I sold everything I worked for, for 48 yrs, since I was 16…
There is something wrong with these rules and I would like someone to take action on it, because I am sure I am not the only person in America in this situation!!
I have Peritoneal Carcinoma. I am trying to raise money to pay for my cancer treatments, AND raise awareness of this rare cancer, Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma, very similar to Ovarian, but spread on the peritoneal lining.
But I also would like someone to realize how silly some of the requirements for Medicare/Medicaid are!!                                                                                        Or if there is someone out there that knows a solution, other than donations, I would love to get their help. I am not proud!!! Each Chemo session is almost 20k!! I get one every 3 wks.
I want people to be aware that this Cancer has no Symptoms, other than being tired. During an emergency surgery due to a strangulated Hernia the surgeon saw spots in my peritoneal lining and if it hadn't been for the hernia, right now I could be dead...So I consider that a miracle! I had just tiredness, and minor pains in the abdomen, which of course I attributed to the hernia.
To top it all because I had a previous hernia, in a different location, the insurance I have, refuses to pay for all the cancer testing and prolonged stay in the hospital because I was taken to the hospital due to a hernia. And they refuse to pay my chemo because one of their clauses written in "fine letters" in the contract, requires hospitalization overnight to pay for chemo. No one stays overnight for chemo!! And they pay a maximum of 1000 for testing!!
Just one PET scan is 4k!!
I know..I know.. I didn't read all the fine writing!!! I know it's my fault for going cheaper, but this is a huge company, a division of a HUGE LIFE INS. CO. based in NY, so I trusted them.. I didn't read the entire 30 page contract...I am at the end of my rope...I worked for 48 years out of 64...and I will lose my excellent credit…and everything I own.
My grown children have families of their own, I have no husband and I don't know where to turn. I am determined to survive, so I can write about this journey!
In the event I do not make it I have arranged for my body to be donated to science, so the money will not be wasted on "ashes"...and someone can potentially get life ...from my remains.
If you have any helpful information or if you have questions, you can write to me at iepfeiffer@gmail.com
Thank you for all that you can do. Any help is appreciated.
Sincerely,
Ingrid Pfeiffer in Maryland

story:
(FOR ENGLISH SCROLL DOWN)



EEN TRANSPLANTATIE. LEG UIT.

Drie jaar geleden ben ik afgestudeerd aan de Arnhemse toneelschool. Ik verheugde me op een spannende tijd waarin ik veel projecten kon aannemen maar slechts vier maanden later werd er bij mij colitis ulcerosa vastgesteld. Er is geen geneesmiddel voor deze ziekte en van dokters kreeg ik te horen dat het vanaf nu per jaar slechter zou gaan. Ik zou veel tijd moeten doorbrengen bij het toilet.

Waarom een transplantatie?

Laat ik eerst uitleggen wat deze transplantatie inhoudt. De officiele term hiervoor is FMT (fecal microbiotic transplantation) oftewel poeptransfusie in de volksmond. Wat doet het dat normale medicijnen niet doen? Het reset je darmflora en herstelt schade dat is aangericht door een ongebalanceerde darmflora, zoals ik heb. En hopelijk zal het in mijn geval me ook van de medicijnen af helpen zodat ik eindelijk weer kan aansterken in plaats van af takelen.

De afgelopen drie jaar is het moeilijk geweest om te voelen hoe mijn lichaam langzaam achteruit ging. Ik heb een dieet kunnen vinden waarmee ik er tegen heb kunnen vechten door het weglaten van alle granen, rijst, aardappels, suikers, melk, soja etc. Ik kan me niet eens meer herinneren wanneer ik mijn laatste pizza heb gegeten. Helaas heb ik niet altijd controle over wat ik eet en soms krijg ik toch iets binnen wat mijn darmen niet aan kunnen. En daar word ik moe van. Vooral wanneer het lijstje met eten wat je mag alleen maar korter wordt.

Deze behandeling zal hopelijk mijn darmflora herstellen. Het kan betekenen dat ik nooit meer medicijnen hoef te slikken en dat ik van mijn dieet af kan (gedeeltelijk). Niet meer bang zijn om te eten. GEWOON TE ETEN. Op sociaal vlak me weer op mijn gemak ga voelen. Kan werken en gewoon weer kan leven zoals voor de diagnose. Het is moeilijk om thuis te zitten vanwege een ziekte. En dit is een kans waarmee ik de kern van het probleem kan aanpakken. Die moet ik pakken!



WAT IK NODIG HEB.

Voor deze behandeling en reis heb ik €8300.- nodig

Waar gaat het geld naartoe?

De FMT kost £4000.-. Omgerekend is dat €4900.-. Dat zijn de kosten voor tien behandelingen over twee weken bij de Taymount kliniek in Engeland. Ze vragen een extra £1000.- omdat ik geen ‘UK resident’ ben. In totaal zal ik €6200.- nodig hebben voor de behandeling.

Omdat de behandeling is Engeland is zal ik nog een extra €2100.- nodig hebben voor reis en verblijfkosten voor een periode van twee weken. Een hotel kost daar rond de €55.- per nacht X 14 is €775.-. Vliegtickets zullen maximaal €400.- kosten. Het eten zal ongeveer rond de €40.- per dag zijn (vanwege het Paleo/SCD-dieet dat ik volg), €560 voor 14 dagen.  Alles bij elkaar €1735.-

Waarom dan de rest van het geld?

Er bestaat een kans dat er meer infusies moeten worden gedaan dan gepland. Omdat dat onzeker is zal ik niet om meer vragen maar zal ik wel een kleine buffer hebben voor onvoorziene kosten.



DE IMPACT.

Nog een reden waarom ik het belangrijk vindt om dit te ondergaan is om andere mensen met colitis ulcerosa of andere vormen van darmproblemen dat er meerdere therapieën zijn. Therapieen die werken, zelfs als ze nog niet goed gekeurd zijn door de medische wetenschappen. Zodat mensen in ieder geval weten dat ze opties hebben en niet alleen de medicijnen die de artsen volgens protocol voor schrijven. Zodat ik hopelijk een nieuw succesverhaal kan vertellen en bij kan dragen aan het behandelen van deze ziekte bij deze behandelingen.  Ik zal elk persoon die ik tegenkom met hetzelfde als ik aanmoedigen om dit te ondergaan. En hoop om een voorbeeld te zijn van het goede resultaat.



FMT, EEN UITDAGING.

Het is niet makkelijk dit openbaar te doen. Het wordt ook niet makkelijk om de behandelingen te ondergaan. Er zit een zekere ‘yuck’ factor aan waar ik me overheen moet zetten aangezien het gewoon om ontlastingtransfusie gaat. Iemand anders zijn poep in je krijgen is niet bepaald een droom geweest voor mij. Maar ik ben bereid om die ‘yuck’ te weerstaan. Ik moet wel.

Zodra ik in Hitchin kom zal ik een blog bijhouden. Waarin ik elke stap zal beschrijven van de ervaring. Als mensen dit lezen en zien hoe ik het onderga, kan het misschien voor hun de ‘yuck’factor weg nemen. Daarnaast denk ik dat het fijn is om niet alleen te zijn als ik dit onderga.



ANDERE MANIEREN OM TE HELPEN


Als je genoeg geld hebt dan zou ik je graag willen vragen om een donatie.

Als je dit niet hebt maar wel veel vrienden zou ik je willen vragen om dit bericht te sharen via FB, Twitter of email.

En mocht je genoeg geld én vrienden hebben dan graag allebei :-)

Als je mensen kent die hier ook aan lijden en die hulp nodig hebben, voel je vrij om contact op te nemen. Ik weet veel over voeding en zal graag mijn ervaringen en recepten delen.

HET EERSTE DOEL IS BEREIKT! 15 APRIL IS DE DAG! DANK IEDEREEN!

HET TWEEDE DOEL IS OM BEREIKT! NU KAN IK DE BEHANDELING OOK ECHT ONDERGAAN! 

DERDE EN LAATSTE DOEL IS OM HET BEDRAG VOL TE KRIJGEN ZODAT IK ER OOK ECHT HEEN KAN!

MOCHT ER MEER GELD BINNENKOMEN DAN DE 100% WAAR IK OM VRAAG DAN ZAL IK DAT GELD INVESTEREN IN EXTRA BEHANDELINGEN DIE BEVROREN MEE KUNNEN NAAR HUIS.

Zodra ik al het geld bij elkaar heb gehaald en de behandeling ben ondergaan nodig iedereen uit om te komen naar mijn theatersolo!

Dankbaar voor wat ik krijg.


(ENGLISH VERSION)


A transplant. Why?

Three years ago I graduated from the theatreschool in Arnhem. As I was picturing myself going from one project to the other after four months I was diagnosed with this cripling disease called Ulceritive Colitis, A INFLAMMABLE BOWEL DISEASE. There is no known cure for this disease and doctors told me to prepare for the regression my body will endure each year. I would see more of the toilet each year to come.

So why a transplant? 

First step is calling it a fecal microbiotic transplantation. What does it do that normal medicine can't do? It re-populates my un-balanced gut flora and restores any damage that has been done and hopefully will rid me of the medicine. Throw me in remission and let my body start developing instead of declining. 

It's been tough feeling my body decline so fast and get sick so easily. I have been able to fight the disease with a strict diet. I'm not eating grains, rice, potatoes, sugars, milk, soja etc. I can't even remember the last time I ate pizza. But in a world where we do not always have control on what is in our food, sometimes ingredients that are bad for me get through and I get sick. I am tired of it. Especially when the list with of food you can eat gets shorter over a period of time. 

This FMT will restore my gut-flora hopefully. It may mean no more medicine and no more being sick. Not being scared to eat anymore. BEING ABLE TO EAT. Being able to engage socially. Work and just have a normal way of living. It's hard sitting home (chained to the toilet) because of your medical condition. This is a chance that can beat medicine and go to the root of the problem. And I need to grab this oppurtunity!

What I need.

What I need for this treatment is €8300.-

Where does the money go?

The FMT itself costs £4000.- which is €4900.- when you calculate that. Thats the costs for ten treatments over a period of two weeks at the taymount clinic in the uk.  They charge another £1000.- for the treatment because I am no UK resident. So I will need €6200.- to cover medical bills.

Because the treatment is in the UK I need another €2100.- for travel, accomadation and food over a two week period of time. A regular hotel costs around 55 euro's a night. Making it 775 for 14 nights. Count in the flight tickets Max of €400.-. And nutrition per day is about €40.- (cause of the paleodiet i'm following) times 14 makes it 560. Together summing up for 1735 euro's. 

So why do I need the rest of the money? 

There is a possibility that the treatment will take more infusions than planned. But because that is uncertain I wont ask for more but would like to have a small buffer so that I wont come in unforseen debts.

The Impact

Another reason why this is valuable is to show people who are suffering from Ulceritive Colitis or any other form of IBD that there are different sorts of treatments. Treatments that work even though they are not approved yet. To get people with this disease hoping again. Get this treatment another success story to encourage people to go and cure themselves. To get governments to approve these kind of highly succesfull treatments. I will encourage every person I meet with the same condition to apply themselves, as I do now. And hope to be a shining example of the positive results.

FMT, a challenge.

I admit it is not easy for me going public with this. It won't be easy undergoing the treatments. There is a certain 'yuck' factor I will need to overcome. These FMT's are actually pooptransplants.  Getting healthy fiecies from someone else in your body is not something you dream about (positively). But I am willing to suppres that 'yuck'. I have to. When I get to Hitchin, where the treatment will take place, I will post a blog every day. Explaining and telling, step by step, how the experience is. If people see and hear me undergo it, maybe it will take the 'yuck' factor away for them. Plus I think that if I share, I won't be standing alone in this battle.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute  financially but want to contribute and you have a lot of friends: share this message! Through FB, Twitter, email. Please do!

If you are capable of contributing financially and you are rich on friends as well do both :-)

If you know other people who are suffering from this disease and need support, feel free to contact me. I know a lot about nutrition and what to and not to eat. I will be more than happy to share.

THE FIRST GOAL ACHIEVED! THANK YOU EVERYONE! APRIL 15 IS THE DAY!

SECOND GOAL ACHIEVED! NOW I CAN ACTUALLY HAVE THE TREATMENT! 

THIRD AND LAST GOAL IS TO REACH THE 100% SO I CAN ACTUALLY GO AND STAY THERE . 

(IF I PASS THE 100% I WILL INVEST THE MONEY IN ADDITIONALL TREATMENTS THAT I CAN TAKE HOME WITH ME IN A FROZEN STATE)


ONCE THE MONEY HAS BEEN RAISED AND I COMPLETED THE TREATMENT I WILL PERFORM MY THEATRE SOLO TO EVERYONE WHO HAS CONTRIBUTED! (In Holland ofcourse)

Gratefull for anything I get.

story:
Most toothbrushes (yes.. even the fancy ones) are primitive and ineffective. We just move plaque and bacteria around hoping to spit it out after. If you look at innovation of other industries, there’s drastic progress; for example in facial care, light therapy is commonly used to promote healing and kill bacteria. It is time to break lose from conventional toothbrushing and enter a new era of at-home oral care!

 

 

 

 

Bristl is simplistic on the outside, but packed with tech on the inside:

 

 

Still not sure? No worries. The Journal of Periodontology reported a study where patients undergoing gum treatment used Bristl. They found that compared to brushing with a conventional electric toothbrush, brushing with Bristl using light therapy was more effective by: 

 

 

Light therapy was discovered by a scientist by the name Niels Finsen almost a hundred years ago for which he won the Nobel Prize in Medicine. Light therapy is nothing new to healthcare - similar red and blue lights are often used in facial care to kill bacteria and heal/tighten skin. Bristl is bringing effective light therapy to the normal toothbrushing routine.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Although every project has its risks, the Bristl team is confident that we have minimized all possible risks. We are working with an industry leading custom manufacturer that has impressive experience and is extremely reliable. In short, we can confidently say that you will receive the best product we can deliver in a timely manner.

A large amount of resources have been dedicated to development, prototyping, and manufacturability. We cannot wait to get this product in our backers' hands! We have surpassed the prototype phase and have had samples manufactured in a "mass-produced" fashion to ensure high quality at scale. On top of this, our supply chain has been tested and has a 100% success rate of on time delivery.

All our ducks are in a row (..a very straight and well tested row), and now we just need support from backers to push this business into reality.

The risks we face are those that every business faces. For example, there is always a risk of hazardous shipping conditions from overseas. There also may be a risk of domestic shipping damage. Don't worry! If that happens, we'll replace any products that have been damaged during shipping. While we feel it is very minimal, there is always a risk of faulty electrical wiring. Again, if this is the manufacturer's error, we will certainly replace damaged products.

We're excited and will keep backers informed every step of the way.
